content:
y 31
												As a newcomer to the Borderlands series I can safely say BL2 is a great game with no previous experience needed. I simply suggest you read a 2-minute plot summary of the first game and you're good to go! As always, I'll try to make a brief list on my pro's and cons to this game. If you have any questions or want me to clarify you can always leave a comment.GOODS+Don't need previous experience to play the sequel.+Guns, guns, guns. Lots of variety to keep the carnage fresh+Cool enemies to shoot your cool guns at.+Feels fast paced for an RPG-type game. Discourages farming with a solid experience system.+Story is very engaging. It falls apart a bit by the end, but aside from that it's really solid storytelling.+Characters and humour are a big part of this game's iconic personality.+I definitely recommend playing it with 2 friends. It's ok on your own, but works better in a small group, though 4 people can get a bit hard to co-ordinate. Great co-up game.+Connecting and joining with friends is really easy to do and mostly ran smoothly.+It has some replay value with the Newgame+ options, different characters and the chance for new legendary items.+Lots of fun challenges, secrets and easter eggs to find for a completionist like me!+The stat numbers of all your guns and items are a bit overwhelming at first, but the interface is pleasant enough that you can get used to it quickly.+Handsome JackNOT-SO-GOODS-If you don't like the humour or tone of this game, BL2 will probably annoy you quickly as it's an ever-present factor throughout the entire thing.-As an RPG it's leveling-up system is kinda lacking. Aside from small bonuses and one single ability there is no difference between your character and any-one elses. They did this so that any character could use any weapon/tactic with no real restrictions, which is good, but has it's downsides. Would've been fun to have at least 1 ability for every tree, or something along those lines.-Lack of voice commands and 'gesture' animations means you'll NEED a microphone to efficiently work together. Their exclusion is weird since even the most basic of co-up games tend to have at least a few voice commands like "Help", "Thanks" and "Move up" to prevent the need for one.-The 'random' nature of the game in terms of drops and rewards might not be your thing. It does help forcing some surprise and variation in playstyle sometimes, which is good. But not vfor every one.-DLC's are overpriced especially for such an old game. No reason to paywall extra content for what could be future fans.-Some weird structure choices. One example: So the main quest requires you to build a car. You go to a whole new area with new places and characters to get this car. You finally get this car, you drive it up to the story mission and... after honking your horn you immediatly get out. With the next vehicle-section being literally hours away. My partners in crime were NOT amused.And that's it for now. All in all Bordelands 2 is a definite recommendation for FPS-lovers even in 2017. If exploring a big, new planet filled to the brim with violence sounds like it might be your thing, be sure to give this a try! Might edit it later if I come up with some more points. Have any questions? Be sure to ask!Have a nice day.

number of helpful: 26 of 27 people (96%) found this review helpful
content:
1, 2014
												9! 24! 58! 100! 500! 1000! Critical! Is there a better visual barometer for satisfaction in videogames than damage numbers popping out of an enemy’s bullet-riddled head? The original Borderlands revelled in this instant gratification, complementing this core conceit with a ‘bazillion’ guns, tight shooting, addictive loot and a droll sense of humour. There’s little wonder why it was such a surprise hit back in 2009, and just as unsurprising that we’re back on the bombastic world of Pandora for Borderlands 2; a sequel that once again basks in the glow of numbers and bullets, hidden treasures and boner jokes.Set five years after the events of the first game, Borderlands 2 features an entirely new cast of playable vault hunters. After the original group opened the fabled vault and dealt with what was hidden therein, an arrogant prick by the name of Handsome Jack took credit for their actions, declared himself the dictator of Pandora, and is now attempting to plunder the planet of its most valuable resources, hoping to awaken some sort of ancient alien power. You’ll team up with a resistance movement led by the original cast of vault hunters, intent on stopping him and looting the entire planet along the way.Those same original vault hunters also now have dialogue, fleshing them out as actual characters after their previous stint as mostly silent protagonists. Borderlands 2 presumes you have some sort of reverence for the original cast despite their previous silence, but their inclusion and subsequent portrayals pay off in some interesting ways, both in regards to the narrative and the game’s humour. Most of the dialogue is fairly sharp across the board and its multitude of zany characters, new and old. The first game’s wacky sense of humour remains, with continuous pop culture references and a ludicrous amount of hidden Easter eggs, and this carries into some of the quest design and its inherent physical comedy.The humour’s in-your-face nature can be a little much at times, especially when jokes miss or drag on for far too long, but the near constant stream of dialogue keeps Pandora feeling alive, especially in the once-lonely single player. It can be immature at times, relying on cheap gags to generate a chuckle, but there’s also a lot of humorous dialogue that will consistently muster more than a laugh or two, and the majority of its voice acting sells each character with aplomb, delivering some fantastic performances.The most substantial improvements come in the gameplay and how you’re able to spec your character. In the first game you could pick the Soldier class, for instance, and by the end of the game you were essentially invincible if you spec’d in the right directions. Your deployable turret could not only lay waste to everything in sight but could also regenerate health and ammunition, leaving you free to stand still and eradicate an entire group of enemies with relative ease. Borderlands 2 has been reworked and is much more balanced, giving each character class a specific playstyle that comes with their action skill and making sure to never overpower them to tedium. There are three skill paths to choose from, each one focusing on specific areas, whether it’s improving your action skill, allowing you to do higher damage with certain weapon types, increasing your maximum health and so on. The Assassin, for example, is very similar to the Hunter class from the first game, focusing on sniper rifles and improving their effectiveness. But each class plays much differently in Borderlands 2, so the Assassin’s action skill is comparable to the Siren’s previous phasewalk ability, allowing him to turn invisible for a brief amount of time where he can utilise his melee attacks; something the Berserker class focused on in the first game. The gun manufacturers now produce particular kinds of weapons with their own distinct visual characteristics. One such manufacturer is Jakobs, who build Wild West style guns so you’ll find lots of revolvers and rifles that can fire as fast as you can pull the trigger but reload very slowly. Maliwan, on the other hand, builds weapons that deal out elemental damage, so they’re your go to guys if you want to set someone on fire.Whichever concoction of assorted weaponry you choose, Borderlands 2’s gunplay is tight and intuitive. Whether it’s popping the heads off bandits, melting a robot down with corrosive ammunition or hitting a Skag with the butt of your rifle, the combat remains entertaining long past your first playthrough and into new game+. This is thanks in no small part to improvements made to enemy AI. In Borderlands 2, enemies now move with more purpose and dexterity, keeping you on your toes and forcing you to adjust your aim as they dodge and roll, duck and weave. It’s not a massive enhancement in artificial intelligence, but it’s an improvement that gives the combat a more frenetic pace. Suicidal psychos will often charge you, explosives at the ready, while various projectiles are thrown in your direction. You’re constantly dashing from place to place and there’s a fantastic freedom of movement. There’s a phenomenal agglomeration of enemies, each befitting of some sublime character design and enjoyable AI. You’ll face off against cloaked monsters, robots that can transform into makeshift tanks and a gargantuan bandit that bursts into a fit of rage, killing friend and foe alike. Each enemy requires a different tactic to beat, whether it’s utilising your action skill, equipping a weapon with a particular type of elemental damage or inciting enemy v enemy combat.The game looks sublime on PC as well, particularly if you can run it on close to the highest settings. The cel-shaded art style never fails to shine and there’s some outstanding lighting effects that complement the level design. This is still the same Pandora as the first game but it’s been injected with a burst of colour and environmental variety. The desert wasteland still remains but now there are plains of green grass, snow swept icy caverns and a deep underground mine coated in luminous green acid. The colour pops with the art style like a comic book; Pandora’s exalted sense of place and character still remains.Borderlands 2 successfully maintains every aspect that made the first game such a surprise hit and improves upon them in all the ways that matter. The majority of these improvements may only be incremental which gives the impression Gearbox took the safe route, avoiding major iteration, but the formula still works. Whether that formula still appeals to you is the real question. If you’ve already spent countless hours with the first game is more Borderlands something you want? If it is then Borderlands 2 is a better game than its predecessor in every way. Just only by a smidgen.

content:
er 3, 2014
												I went into the Borderlands series with this game and not knowing anything about it really.  I decided to start my experience and somewhere between that moment and the multitute of hours played non stop that preceeded, I had discovered something special indeed. Everything about it sucked me in; the creative art direction, the addicting grind in search of rare loot, and the insane characters that are voiced acted to perfection. The soundtrack plays a major role in this game's success, perfectly lending itself to the atmopshere, as well as some remarkable minimalistic songs used in towns (almost reminiscent of idling in Tristram in Diablo).  It also has something else up its sleeve, something that only comes about every decade or so; the feeling that a definitive classic has been forged, in a modern generation flooded with regurgitated cliches.  Borderlands 2 clevarly adapts gameplay mechanics from tried and true classics such as Diablo and Diablo 2, yet, has been able to produce something entirely unique, a game of the highesty quality and replayablity.Borderlands 2. Time will remember you.

content:
17, 2016
												LAST EDITED: 11/24/16Borderlands 2 is a really incredible game that made the Borderlands franchise one of my favorite franchises to play. Now with that being said, there's a few flaws with the game but I'll discuss it in the pros and cons. While Borderlands is not as successful as other FPS games such as Battlefield and others, Borderlands still holds its own with its developer and easter eggs of other games such as Doom, Minecraft, and others. Anyways enjoy the pros and cons :)Pros:-The selection of weaponry for this game-More campaign DLCs compared to BL1 and BTPS-The skill selections of each vault hunter-The action skills are perfectly designed around that specific character-Amazing weapons especially in Captain Scarlett and her Pirate's Booty DLC (Sandhawk, Pimpernel, Rapier, etc.)-The general boss and mini boss selection-Dragon Keep DLC (my personal favorite)-Some Pearlescent and Seraph weapons are excellent/phenomenal (Bekah, Butcher, Tattler, Interfacer, etc.) -The Pearlescent Jakobs Bekah (my all time favorite weapon in Borderlands 2)-The variety of phenomenal legendaries (Norfleet, Unkempt Harold, Fastball, etc.)-Salvador + 5 points of Money Shot + Chaotic Evil Monk class mod (Dragon Keep exclusive) = AN INSTRUMENT OF DEATH!-Moxxi weapons due to the healing per damage dealt percentage and some heal passively (Grog Nozzle, Heartbreaker, Hail, Slow Hand, Kitten, etc.)- Zer0's B0re skill + 1 Basic Repeater + Hyperius = Amazing Results :D-Some E-tech weapons are excellent (Florentine, Yellow Jacket, Plasma Casters of all manufacturers except Bandit, Slow Hand, Swordsplosion, Norfleet, Omen, Longbow sniper rifles, PBFG rocket launcher, Topneaa)-Despite the self slag on the Chulainn, it's a good weapon to use if you're using a Bee shield since its sister weapon, the Florentine doesn't benefit as much from the Bee shield-The Double Penetrating *GIGGITY* Unkempt Harold is absolutely broken-The Morningstar ;) (That should be a hint to this point but the veterans know about this one!)Cons:-Axton can be fixed but he's designed fine as the concept behind him was made-Many of the pearlescents and seraphs are currently awful/mediocre (Patriot, Bearcat, -The pain of Vermivorous, Hyperius, Master Gee, Voracidious, and Dexiduous-Some guns can be fixed but in general all guns are fine-E-techs lack the critical hit modifiers to match unique weapons and are inferior to weapons of purple or purple gemstone (Dragon Keep exclusive) rarity-E-tech guns cannot crit at all and have high ammo consumption-Torgue barreled assault rifles cannot crit at all-Digistruct Peak's insane pain (I earned OP8 months after I got the DLC)-The DREADED Landscaper shotgun (when fired the bullets move away from the crosshairs)-Many weapons have slow projectile speed and/or lackluster accuracy especially the Seraph weapons in Captain Scarlett and her Pirate's Booty DLC-The Chulainn SMG's self slag (not bad against melee but very bad against bullets)-Ultimate Vault Hunter Mode balance is not balanced but is fixed in Borderlands: The Pre Sequel-Gearbox broke the Evil Smasher by patching its special effect as a unique weaponPersonally, the argument of both pros and cons can be debated among the player base but I'll leave it up to you if you think it's worth the money to buy this game and the campaign DLCs. In my opinion, I think I can recommend this game to anyone who seems to like video games. Hope this review helped. Thanks for reading :) ~Ky

number of helpful: 24 of 25 people (96%) found this review helpful
content:
7, 2013
												Borderlands 2 is a visual treat and the "shoot and loot" concept makes the game highly addictive. At times, the utterly hectic action can be fantastic fun and, without reservation, it's a game you should buy. But there are problems! There isn't a difficulty setting and people find the game too easy or too hard. The entire game is carefully balanced, and that balance is easily upset, leading to unrewarding play. Also, despite being coop, it's almost impossible to play with friends, because the levelling system makes a huge difference even if you are only a few levels different to each other. The DLC is highly variable. It wasn’t developed by Gearbox, and it show’s. The maps are generally very well designed, but the gameplay and rewards are lacking. In particular, Hamerlock’s is one you just want to get through as quickly as possible. The UVHM is essential though, and probably justifies the price of the Season Pass all by itself.  The bosses do start to get ridiculously tough in the DLC’s, pretty much demanding four players. It’s an incredibly detailed and fun game to play. Yes it has plenty of faults, but it still remains one of the best games ever produced. Now that it's starting to drop in price, you have no excuse not to buy it.

content:
ry 6, 2016
 All of my reviews are based around my personnal opinion, they're not swayed by a majority of people liking or disliking it.   Better than  Destiny [www.destinythegame.com] Worse than  Borderlands 1  NOTE: All of my reviews are laid out in a particular format that fits the game. TL:DR Borderlands 2 was quite an experience. It has everything. Guns, enemies, story, badassness, psychos, annoying robots. Borderlands is one of those games that you don't play for just a couple of hours. If you have friends you can play this game with, the game has become twice as more fun. With beautiful locations, an amazing story and hilarious characters this is an absolute must recommend! Buy it already! About Borderlands 2 is a first-person shooter RPG where you choose one of four characters, (six if you have the dlcs) and start through an epic journey. The game is set on a planet called Pandora, which is inhabited by bandits. You may notice in the trailer, there are a lot of guns. All unique in their own way. You can have a gun that shoots fire, you can have a gun that electrifies people e.t.c. Borderlands 2 is one of those story rich games that is even better with other people. A successor to the original, with added detail, more characters, and whole new locations ranging from freezing ice plains, to deserts, and even to countrysides, Borderlands, even with death everywhere, has a beauty to it. Gameplay It's a first-person shooter, gameplay is going to be the main part in it. This game is filled with action almost all the time. There are dozens of types of enemies which can harm you in different ways. The game may make you rely on different types of weapons. For example, an armoured enemy will take more damage from a corrosive weapon, an enemy with a shield will take more damage from an electric weapon, or an enemy with no defense would take even more damage from an incendiary weapon. This can be awkward if you don't have those weapons. As I mentioned before, this game is amazing if you have friends playing it with you. The more people in a game with you, the harder the enemies, but also the better the loot. Go through an epic journey exploring the wilds, completing side quests and complain about who gets what weapon. Then there's the dlcs.... Story Note that I'm not going to spoil the story at all in this. Only the basis of it.One of the best stories I've ever seen in a video game. It has exciting, dramatic parts, to emotional and sad parts. Borderlands 2 always keeps you on your toes. The story is set on a planet called Pandora, which has an uninvited guest, a company called Hyperion. The leader, Handsome Jack, wants to mine a mysterious alien element called eridium, to open a ruin on Pandora called, The Vault. You, and/or your friends are tasked with saving the planet, and defeating Handsome Jack. As well as a main story, there are also side quests, which contain their own stories within them. There are hundreds of side quests in the game for you to explore, and if need be, build XP on to level up.  Design & Graphics Borderlands 2, as you can see by the screenshots, is a very cartoonish game, but not in the way you might imagine it. Although cartoonish, It's actually beautiful. Some environments leave you stunned. Graphics can be adjusted in the settings to make the game look even more pretty. If you don't have a perfect PC, this game can lag quite a lot, and the FPS can go down really low. Again, for the design, It's sublime. Almost everything is detailed. Open wildernesses are detailed quite well. The only negative thing I'll mention is mushy backdrops in some places. UI [User Interface] The Ui is rather basic to be quite honest. You have a basic hud in-game which shows your health, your shield, your ammo, your ability and a minimap. When you press the tab button, you open up a new menu which manages your inventory, your skill tree, your quests, your map and your challenges. You shouldn't have any problem navigating where to go. The game gives you basic tutorials on where everything is anyway. The main menu is also rather basic. Settings are easy to navigate. Had no problems here, neither should anyone else. Pros - An amazing story- Hilarious characters- Beautiful environments- Great soundtrack- Worth plenty of hours of playtime- Entertaining co-op- Great replay value- So many guns!!!!- Epic DLCs Cons - Inventory space can be a pain.- Sometimes relying on co-op too much.- Sometimes bland backdrops.- Some PCs may struggle when it comes to FPS. Final Recommendation Borderlands 2 is an almost perfect game, which is worth hundreds of hours of playtime. Whether it be alone or with friends, this game is addicting as hell. I'm still not bored of it and I doubt I will be for a long time. Finishing the game may seem like you've done a lot, but then you hae the dlcs to finish, which will give you even more guns, and even more fun!!! A must play for anyone, even if it's not on sale! Final Verdict - 10/10.

			Views: 1,716,213		

			You're going to need a lot of guns to survive the Doomsday that has come in Borderlands 2. Check out the characters, the visceral action and even a dancing robot.

*English*RPG and FPS fell in love and had a child – its name is Borderlands 2The game has extremely charming characters (even the villains), a hilarious acid type of humor and an almost infinite variety of weapons and items.Borderlans 2 is infinitely better than the first title of the series. The characters and map progression is very fluid, unlike the 1st game where I often found myself “stuck”, forced to grind on(in) a map where I had already completed all quests, just to be able to survive on the following quests / maps.Besides the singleplayer mode, there is also a coop one with up to 4 players. It’s hard to find random people to play online, but it’s guaranteed fun if you have a group of friends to play with.*Português*RPG e FPS se apaixonaram e tiveram um filho - seu nome é Borderlands 2.Tem personagens extremamente carismáticos (até mesmo os vilões), um humor ácido hilário e uma variedade quase infinita de armas e itens.Borderlands 2 é infinitamente melhor que o primeiro jogo da série. O progresso do personagem e a mudança de mapas são bastante fluídos, ao contrário do 1º jogo, em que várias vezes me encontrei "travada", obrigada a "grindar / upar" em um mapa no qual já tinha feito todas as missões, apenas para conseguir sobreviver à missão / mapa seguinte.Além do modo singleplayer, possui também um modo coop de até 4 jogadores. É difícil achar pessoas aleatórias para jogar online, mas é garantia de diversão caso você possa jogar com um grupo de amigos.

												One word..."Amazing"I love this game. This is my most played game (unless you count hours I spent on Super Smash Bros on the Wii, and the F2P games of League of Legends and TF2)The game itself is great. Improved upon the original. With new characters and new abilities. I am glad I bought this game pre-release, and all the dlc content (not the skins).People may complain that they do not get everything with the GOTY edition. But here's the thing everything thats not in the GOTY is just skins. The headhunters are just a skin pack basically. You get 1 new one with each character instead of buying 1 per character at a set amount. Yea maybe there is a mission, but the mission has nothing to do with the main game and is just so you can earn that character skin.The main DLC itself. I would rate Tiny Tina's DLC as one of the best side stories I have ever played - you have knights, monsters, warlocks, dragons, magic missiles, SWORDSPLOSIONS!!!. It also delves into the mind of a child dealing with grief.The other DLC, Pirates and Torque are also very good. Mister Torque is one of my favorite new characters (after Tiny Tina of course). EXPLOSIONS!!!All in all, I recommend this game hands down one of my all time favorite games. Hopefully, you will find it enjoyable as well.

												If you are here to read a review for Borderlands 2, you came to the wrong place.However, here is a fantastic Deep Dark Chocolate Cake Recipe;Ingredients:2 cups granulated sugar (500 mL)1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour (425 mL)3/4 cup HERSHEY'S Cocoa (175 mL)1 1/2 tsp baking powder (7 mL)1 1/2 tsp baking soda (7 mL)1 tsp salt (5 mL)2 eggs (2)1 cup milk (250 mL)1/2 cup vegetable oil (125 mL)2 tsp vanilla extract (10 mL)1 cup boiling water (250 mL)BUTTERCREAM FROSTING6 tbsp butter or margarine, softened (90 mL)2 2/3 cups icing sugar (650 mL)1/2 cup HERSHEY'S Cocoa (125 mL)1/3 cup milk (75 mL)1 tsp vanilla extract (5 mL)Directions:1. Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch (1.5 L) round baking pans or one 9 x 13-inch (3.5 L) baking pan.2. Stir sugar with flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a large bowl. Add eggs, milk, oil and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer, on medium speed, for 2 minutes. Stir in boiling water (batter will be thin). Divide batter evenly between prepared pans.3. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes for the round pans (35 to 40 minutes for the large pan) or until a wooden pick inserted in the centre comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes on a rack. Turn cakes out from pans; cool completely. (Sheet cake may be left in pan if desired.) Makes 8 to 10 servings.4. Buttercream Frosting: Beat butter in medium bowl. Combine the icing sugar with the cocoa. Alternately add the icing sugar mixture and the milk to the butter, until a spreadable consistency is reached (additional milk may be required to reach preferred consistency). Stir in vanilla. Frost cooled cake.Makes about 2 cups (500 mL) of frosting.

content:
y 28, 2015
												loot and shoot.Buy advice: [Borderlands 2 GOTY edition + Ultimate Vault Hunter Upgrade Pack 2] buy these two during a steam sale is the best advice I can give for anyone. It'll run you right now about $15-$18 and you'll have all the DLC's worth having without rebuying or spending a bunch of money. It gets asked constantly in the forums. Classic FPS that can have a high entertaintement/hour value with replayable storylines, scaleable enemies, with better and better loot as you go. There are three main types of BL2 players I've seen. You have the diehard, the casual, and the barely interested. The diehards love doing the playthroughs, they love farming bosses and loot, they love the skills; they are great players and they have above 1k hours in the game, they can talk shop about this game all day but they're a dying breed because the game does have a half life for how interesting it is; the diehards will buy the game when it comes out, they don't need a steam sale, they'll buy all the DLCs and they bought TPS (the pre-sequel) for $60 the day it came out and already have 50 hours on it. The barely interested will wait for the steam sale, they'll wait for a few friends and they'll play up to level 30, maybe 60, they'll buy only the GOTY version, and theyll have 40 hours and be done with it. The hard part is figuring out if you're a casual player since you've never played the game.The best way for a casual player to play is to select the most interesting character to you (first time favorites: commando, siren, assassin) and you play them through until you finish all the storylines, challenges, achievements, sidemission and do level 1 to 72 to op8, that will take about 200-300 hours. Then you normally don't want to do another complete playtrhough of a couple hundred hours so you get powerleveled through to op8 on the other characters and you can go through the storylines easier, you can play with the skills and see how the skills work and even more fun see how the skills work with all the loot, most likely duped loot. Most of your playtime then will be helping others get there missions done, doing raid bosses, a little farming and the game will reach its half life, that will take another few hundred hours and you'll be finished with the game.

content:
8, 2013
												I can very easily say that this is the finest game that I have ever played.  Borderlands 2 is an improvement (for the better) in nearly every aspect of the original game.  Borderlands 2 comes with a much better story, much more varied environments and enemies, better user interface and more variety in the way the gear behaves.The cooperative system is also very much improved in Borderlands 2.  The game moved away from using Gamespy for an online lobby and now uses full Steam integration with drop-in and out cooperative play.The game features 4 new classes (Soldier, Siren, Gunzerker and Assassin) with 2 others available for purchase via DLC (Mechromancer and Psycho).  Each class features all-new skill trees that have been mostly well designed and appear to work well for both solo and team play.Most of the original cast of NPC characters have returned along with a few new ones.  The story is very well written this time with an extremely interesting villain in Handsom Jack.  The story for Borderlands 2 does attempt to be a continuation of the original game and miraculously improves the previously lackluster story to a point where it now actually makes some sense.  The game also includes a TON of sidequests and activities so you can expect to have about 30 hours of gameplay with the main questline and roughly 50+ hours if you include most of the side activities.  There are 4 large campaign DLC and a variety of smaller DLC packs which will add significantly to an already huge amount of content.The only few negative things that I have found in the game include:1)  Less storage space than you had in the original game.2)  Inability to replay echo logs like you could in the original.3)  There is much more dialog (good) but too easy to interrupt (bad) with no way to replay as mentioned in my second point above.Overall I feel that Borderlands 2 is a huge improvement over the original in most aspects and the many improvements definitely outweigh the few negatives.  I have newer games in my library but this one always keeps drawing me back.

content:
6, 2015
												This is a game that completely shocked me. I knew nothing about Borderlands during it's release. Being honest, I thought, "oh great, another shooter... I bet it's some cliche post apocalyptic first preson shooter where the player is the game's only last hope. Just another Call of Duty. GUNS?! Ughh. Boringgggggg!"HOWEVER, I ended up recieving it as a gift thanks to a good friend, and I was completely wrong.Borderlands 2 is meant to be played CO-OP with friends. Everything is well done. The game provides a large variety of guns with different abilities and elements.  You have to plan and think which gun is good for what situation and some are just straight out flashy and worth keeping just for personal preference. There is also a detailed skill tree system that allows the player to create the most BADASS character where the player can focus on what they want the most on. Best of all, there no pressure because everything is straight out obvious and there no PVP, so you never feel overwhelmed by tryign to make a perfect character to compete with others. I choose the cheap way and just max out my Turrent on the Commendo class. While the good character creation and a variety of guns are great, the gameplay can vary. At times, it can get really intense, ostentatious, BADASS! Hordes of enemies left to right, explosions everywhere, your PC probably screaming and explosing inside by the amount of particles  and graphical effects happenning in your screen. But, if you aren't a fan of shooters, you may at times find it repetitive as there are certain moments that feel the same. Some can argue it's just player heads to objective and kill a horde of enemies every time. I can't blame you if you feel like that, but...Borderlands 2 is the epitone for story games that prove that a fantastic story makes a game better even if it feels like a fetch and grind MMO style game. It took a game that barely had a story and  used all the characters and story plot to create this  shockly interesting story. It's like if you took coal and turn it into gold, but this is gold writing!  In addition, Handsome Jack, a new character, is pretty much the main star of the game as he guides the player throughout the game and introduces the history of Paradora. The humor in some way is very immature, childish, and goofy that you'd think it would have been written by a 12 year old. However, in my opinion everything is soo balance and even immature cussing jokes are actually funny and never feel overuesd. Being a child I am, I always get a laugh when I hear the word "Badass". (However, I know some people would disagree, so read about it with caution when buying). Reguardless, it's soo well done that you end up wanting to know more about the game, so you end up doing every single side quest just to know what exactly happen. Almost no quest feels like a chore because the story is what motivates you to keep playing. During your progression, he does so many bad thing in such a sarcastic and sinster way that you can't wait to have the opporunity to punch him right in his freaken handsome face. but at the same time, you begin to hate him in a way that you're actually interested in knowing more about him if that makes sense. Who exactly is he, how did he take over Hyperion corporation, why does he hate you and the vault hunters so much, why is he so freaken handsome?!?!!Buy the GOTY during a sale! Some of the season pass and level packs expansion are essential for the true experience! Tiny Tina's Assault on Dragon Keep expansion DLC is the minimum you need if you are just interested in the story because it is the conclusion of the story of Borderlands 2. This is no Mass Effect 3, I promise you that! The ending on Borderlands 2 is satisfying, but Tiny Tina concludes the game in a surpising way. Not to mention, who doesn't love dungeons and dragons? Overall, I absolutely recommend this game to anyone as long as you have friends to play with. It can be played alone. If you do, I recommend Commando or Mechromancer class because they have the ability to spawn a turrent or mech-robot that aids the player in tough situations.

If your getting all the dlc...Seraph and Pearlecent are also extra ranks for guns, shields and grenade mods. AND THERE IS ALSO A ♥♥♥♥ TON OF GUNZ.87 BAZILLION to be exact.SOUNDGood music, decent gun sounds, I dont really have much to say about sound, but it has a decent soundtrack, you wont be dissapointed.STORY The game takes place in a kind-of SCI-FI setting with comedy and humor of all kinds. the story is this... I dont know if this if a spoiler or not but here it is... At the ending of the first Borderlands, they referenced Hyperion, 5 years later, someone named Handsome Jack wants to take control of pandora with a vault, but not any vault, a living dragon cute and cuddly thing called the warrior and you gotta stop it to prevent wide extinction of life all across the planet. not gonna tell you more cuz thats spoilers.FINAL VERDICT 10/10You will not regret buying this game...Buy it now...

												I love this game. It's probably one of the best first person shooter games that I've ever played. It's just plain fun the controls feel nice and if you don't like them you can change them. The graphics are different but they actually work really well for this game. The whole MMO thing is pretty neat making each character feel really different even though they all have access to the same artillery. The game of the year version is pretty worth it adding 4 different dlc areas that each are pretty long. Game of the year also gives you 2 extra characters so that's pretty good. If you are an achievement hunter there's a lot of those that mostly aren't too luck based to get (finding donkey mong ughhhhhhhhhhhhhhh). The multiplayer is good if you know the person and can communicate with them. I find single player better for me at least because I like to move at my own pace. There's also a lot of comedic moments that made me laugh the first time. So in all it's pretty good and you should buy it if this is what you're looking for. Also there are 69 achievements so haha.

content:
, 2016
												Borderlands 2 is a, well let's self proclaim it, a "loot-em-up" first person shooter, created by Gearbox Software and published by 2K Games. The game is still set in Pandora, looking for a Vault after the Borderlands event. But they are different Vault Hunters this time, Maya, Axton, Zer0 and Salvador. Their role and abilities are different, so you pick each one based on what you like. You can now customised your appearance like your head and the costume. I am not going to talk through the details about their each character's abilities, so let's talk about the story, characters, graphics and the features they added. The atmosphere has been improved from its predecessors, including different locations with variety of biomes (snow, desert, etc.), compared to previous instalment where every locations are just only desert terrain. The graphics are amazingly beautiful and colourful with cel-shading, running with Unreal Engine 3. The story is hilariously well done, especially the characters are the funniest like Tiny Tina, Handsome Jack and CL4PTR4P. You'll love them straight away, even I am now a fan of Tiny Tina because of her sense of humor. They also provided some side-quests as you progress the story. The NPCs from previous instalment are back as well, with personality finally. Combat system is still the same formula from the previous game but even better. New feature added, Badass Rank which benefits your stats, depending on how you chose the stats, you can enable it or disable it. To earn it, you need to complete the challenge to earn Badass points. They added a currency feature, like Eridium to increase your inventory, storage capacity and ammo capacity. The enemy A.I. is just tough and punishing but sometimes, A.I. can be dumb or glitchy at times. You can play with your friends up to 4 players on server, but the biggest downside is the looting system because you cannot share the loot, instead they added a trade feature, so if one of your players cannot use it due to its class requirements, benefits of the item and level requirements. On technical flaws, I found some of the most annoying encounters, like walking over the small step of terrain with invisible wall, I mean it's 21st century ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥it. Almost linear design choices with free roam is fine but adding invisible walls on small rocks you can step over or just nearly everything is unacceptable. There are out of bounds on every map but turrets will kill you instantly when passing beyond the area.+ Pros+ Atmosphere with variety of biomes+ LOOT, LOOT, LOOT MORE (I'm crazy about the dropped legendary loots from the fallen bosses)+ Hilarious story+ Replayability available (True Vault Hunter Mode / New Game Plus)+ Well executed character development and introducing characters throughout the story+ Combat System tweak and new features- Cons- Questionable invisible walls on terrains (small stairs, rocks)- Not shared loot system during Co-Op sessionIn this honest review, I highly recommend this game. It's an improved version of Borderlands. For your curiosity, play this game with friends than playing individually. Trust me, it's boring for some people who play this game alone. But for me, I love playing this game alone because of the grind. The story, atmosphere, well character development NPCs, looting system are the biggest improvement from the predecessor but those invisible walls on some terrain and not shared loot system are the weakest link. You will enjoy this game for every second if you play with friends.

er 31, 2013
												Borderlands 2 is a fantastic game if you like what it does, and a boring, tedious waste of time if you don't. It's one of those games that I can understand both why people love and why people hate.In a nutshell, it's a loot centered shooter with some modest RPG elements mixed into the pot. Without going on for hours about the game itself, I personally enjoy it. It has a good, if often crude, sense of humor, a moderate variety of enemy types, and an extremely impressive array of weaponry. As far as first person shooters go, this game is clearly designed to be played with friends, and can be challenging when you do. Overall, I'd say it's definitely worth buying if you enjoy silly, over-the-top action, and just basic brainless stupid fun.

content:
21, 2015
												Wow... I think I'm in love with the Borderlands universe. There's just something really special about this game: the way the characters grow on you, the explosive atmosphere, the compelling story, the weird but incredible way they weave heavy moments and introspection in a game filled to the brim with humor, gore and internet memes. I feel like this game is the best it can get, or at least until Gearbox or some other developer comes up with something even better. With such a diverse cast of characters, I find it hard to imagine NOT being able to relate to at least one of them despite how extreme their personalities can be. It's not all haphazard extremeness either and each is endearing in their own way. The game is very inclusive of queer characters and neurodivergent characters. They follow stereotypes, they break stereotypes, and their differences are natural and introduced as such. Handsome Jack is on par with Pagan Min as my favorite antagonist. Every character feels alive and has defining dialogue and the areas you can explore are often beautiful. Pandora is a harsh yet vibrant world that you will blast through over and over until you finally come out on top. The FPS genre generally isn't very memorable but here's a game that smashes the rules and brings out its own style. Gunplay is the heart of Borderlands and there is a huge number of quests you can complete to gain better guns, loot and experience. I found levelling and looting enjoyable and the skill trees are decent but slightly underwhelming as a lot of them become useless if you grind to endgame difficulty modes. It goes without saying... there's a lot of grinding in this game and a couple "fetch" sidequests. Especially early on when you're stuck with some really low level equipment. But once you get past that initial slow start, the game really picks up and you'll find yourself shooting electricity out of shotguns and facing more challenging opponents with better rewards. I think the only gripe I might have with the gameplay is that some bosses felt poorly designed-- sort of same-y with almost all of them having unavoidable area-of-effect attacks. Until recently the drop rates for legendaries was notoriously difficult but has been fixed. Minor bugs exist but with the rest of the game being completely incredible I found them more funny than annoying.There are four playable characters (plus two more in GOTY edition) that each have their own perks and quotes. No matter who you choose you'll have a good time while they rattle off at enemies or make it to second wind just in time. There's Axton, Pandora's most handsome (next to Jack!) but smart-mouthed bisexual man, who makes a great tank and support. Maya, an ace siren, is my personal favorite with her phaselock ability and makes for a nicely balanced offense and support unit as well. Her background ties her in somewhat with the going-ons of the game and playing her can involve you more in the story. Zer0, my other favorite, is your key "outsider" nameless, mysterious type. He recites haiku and displays emotes on his face.... which is honestly more adorable than it should be. You just can't quite put your finger on him but that's probably part of his charm. It should be noted that although he's an assassin class, there's no stealth (this is not a subtle game!) but over time he can become a very specialized, powerful character. Sal is the only one I haven't tried out yet but from what I've heard his skill tree makes him one of the most OP tanks in the game. Sadly there isn't a lot of backstory on the protagonists but there's plenty on all the other NPCs you'll be dealing with.UPDATE: I've finished playing all the characters to OP8 and Sal is the pure definition of this game. EXPLOSIOOOONS! Gaige and Krieg, the other two characters included in GOTY/season pass as dlc, are fun, fast-paced power tanks. Highly recommended.This is an attractive game full of creativity and it's clear upon playing that the people who made this game really put in a lot of effort and attention (and also memes) into it. Aside from the characters, small details like occasional ECHO logs and the differences in gun part brands add depth. The landscapes and cartoony art are great and perfectly suit the game's action-savvy theme which creates a unique combination of lightheartedness and gore. I loved the day-night transitions and many areas make for some beautiful, detailed scenery that are nice to look at while you're in or out of a fight. The world is literally blowing up with fun! And despite some really tough mobs you'll crawl through, you might find yourself coming back for more because there's nothing quite like it. For a game that makes a million jokes, I copped lots of feels and it somehow really touched me.If you have the time and energy to spare, I strongly recommend the GOTY edition. Tiny Tina and Captain Scarlett's DLC that are included with it are some of the biggest, best DLC I've seen to date. There are many ways to play the game and trying out new characters or difficulty modes lends itself to some high replayability. On days you just want to sit back, kick some butt and feel like a badass, this is the perfect solution for everyone and anyone. Now excuse me while I write a love letter to gearbox.

												Borderlands 2, is, in my opinion, GOTY 2012.Like looting? Check.Don't like looting and just want to proceed with the quest? Check, but do some sidequests to make sure you level up pretty evenly.Do you like an interesting story?   I can't say it's very complex, but it makes you feel with the characters (both lmao and "muh feels")Do you like interesting characters?   It's Borderlands, were you expecting something NOT interesting about them?Do you like content?   Even without GOTY, this game has at least 40~ hours before you beat the main campaign; nevermind the pretty cool sidequests you get.   With GOTY, you can expect well over 120-150 hours before you beat everything (again, with proper side-quest balancing)Personally, I rate this a 9.5/10, since the only drawback I saw was that sidequests WERE a requirement, or else you'll get creamed in the main campaign.    They're not boring though (maybe in contrast to the main campaign), so that's always a plus.

content:
ry 10, 2014
												If I were to describe video games in an extremely complicated metaphor that tied in mammals, reptiles, ethnic food, and figures from mythology, Borderlands 2 would be something like a Platypus-Snake-JapaneseSesameChicken-Surma.Platypus: Why a platypus? Because Platypuses/Platypeese/Platypii are unique. They're a weird hybrid thing that is actually pretty cool. Borderlands is practically a second cousin of the platypus, with all that uniquity. The best way I can think to explain it would be to draw up the image of an MMO. MMOs let you run around, level up, dump skill points everywhere, find loot to kill things to find more loot of varying rarity, and some of them let you enter instanced dungeon areas to kill monsters with your friends (Where applicable). Borderlands is pretty similar to that, but it's a first person shooter. You pick a class, get killed first thing off, and then start your adventure as the semi-official minion of the incessantly talking Wheatley/Gir mashup named Claptrap(More like shut-your-trap, amirite?). Your adventure will have you killing enemies for random loot, levelling up to get different perks that let you build your own style of character, and taking side quests from NPCs. the whole game is like one of those aforementioned instanced dungeons, where you can drag up to three friends (Or, should you lack those, random people online that probably hate you just because they are the internet) and go monster slaying. I've heard that if your friend takes your loot, you can stop being friends and then challenge him to a now-unfriendly duel to kill him and take what's rightfully yours. I wouldn't know, because I don't really..... have... friends. And I hate the internet people. In summary: Borderlands 2 is an FPSMMO but not MMO because instead of being massive multiplayer it's like 4 multiplayer, but still retains all the typical trimmigns of one of the nicer MMOs. It's like halo with quests. After your head finishes exploding at how fun that sounds, carry on reading.Snake: Snakes look pretty cool, and they make neat sounds.You know what else looks cool?I do! I have awesome curly hobbit hair like Frodo. But I'm not the only cool-looking thing around. Cel-shaded graphics are pretty neat as well. Borderlands 2 has a really cool art style that makes it super obvious you're playing Borderlands and not something else. For the easily confused, it may be nice to be able to tell what game you're playing at a glance. Sound-wise, it's wunderbar (German for wonderful. Also useful: "Der Mann isst das Kind" means "I like children", which is good to know because people trust you more if you like children). Everyone's voiced, and they voiced real nice. Guns sound like guns. Bad guys sound like bad guys and say things like "I will kill you" before making guns noises come out of their guns. Japanese Sesame Chicken: HOLY CHILDREN OF GOD SESAME CHICKEN IS GOOD. I order it every time I go to a Japanese restaurant, much in the same way I ordered Borderlands 2. fun is good, and Borderlands 2 is fun. Everyone is funny, and you can't spell funny without fun. You can't spell gun without un, and you can't spell fun without un. You also can't spell undertaker without un, but that's not applicable here. Dialogue is full of funny things, a couple of which made me pause the game so I could laugh for a while (Claptrap talking about his own voice is my favorite line so far). Surma: Surma is the Finnish god of violent death, if wikipedia tells the truth. Science has been performed to prove that wikipedia is true. So scientifically speaking, (Is that what scientology is?) Surma is real, and Surma is in this game a lot because you will death-initely be violently death-ing a whole death-ing lot of things with all your fancy guns you pick up (Which feel great by the way. Some shooters feel horrible, and other just "feel right" or something). Lots of fun stat comparing to be had, so you can put that statistics* class to use for once. It seems like Surma might be the only god in here though, besides maybe the god of fun if that's a thing (Sheogorath?). All your quests will boil down to "walk here" followed by "shoot the bad things" (Don't worry, they are bad things like enemies, so it's fine to shoot them. Claptrap addresses this as well, if you are suffering any moral twinges about this.) and then "pick up the things" and then finally "take the thing to the guy" to get a profitable return. So not much variety. the story behind each will be different, ranging from r/interesting to "You srsly ask me do this."The complete Platypus-Snake-JapaneseSesameChicken-Surma package:I like this game. I only have a couple hours as of this review, but it seems like I'll be grabbing plenty more, even though none of me jolly mates have it. I'll get them eventually. It may eventually wear itself out, but if that unholy grindfest Warframe held my attention for an extreme 172 hours, I don't think I'll get sick of Borderlands 2 anytime soon. ESPECIALLY if my imaginary friends get imaginary computers and play with me.Overall score: Great out of ten. I told steam to give it the blue thumb and not the red one. Hail Surma. *After talking to a dormmate, I have come to realize that statistics is not about how to compare weapon stats in video games. I will try to petition and have that made a thing though.

y 29, 2014
												A lot of different guns with different effects,like slaging for extra dmg, fire dmg, corrosion dmg, electricity dmg, explosion dmg and normal dmg.There are many shields with enhanced capacity or booster shields dropping shield energy items to refresh shield energy before depleted, shields with bonus dmg to melee dmg or 1 unique shield for bonus ranged dmg at full shield capacity.Spiked shields which do dmg to melee attackers and 1 unique shield to ranged attackers(homing spikes shot at).Character class items to improve skills in your skilltree and so on.a lot of different legendary items and also special items which can be purchased in special currencies, like seraph crytals gain at bosses slain on hardest difficulty(also overpowered lvl) and torque tokens collectin at torques campaign or gaining by doing a quest Bar brawl witch can be repeated infinite.If you die you turn in a fight for your life modus,where you after killing an enemy in a short time span, get back into action, otherwise you die and will be respawned at the last waypoint/travelstation, loosing an ammount of money.Travelling by car is good but using travelstations to get fast to other locations is fast and awesome. 6 classes 4regular and 2 dlc chars, 3skilltrees. 4 players coop, you can also duell each other, different looks for your characters, outfits and heads and vehicles skins, Boss enemies for 1 Insane skilled char or for 2-4 Players.Vehicles 2 different cars, in the normal game, at Hammerlocks Hunting Dlc 1 Hovercraft and 1 Boat at Scarlets Pirate Dlc. Doing quests and other tasks gives you Badass rank for some Bonuspoints, increasing gun dmg, gun accuracy or maximum Health, maximum Shields, faster reload and so on. Lvl cap is 72, if you have that Digistruck Peak Dlc, otherwise 50. Great game, but storing Stuff is a problem, shared stash a bit small 4 items, but good that there is one. The regular safe could be pimped by spending eridium bars, also the Ammunition/Grenade capacity you can handle.Funny dialogs and other stuff included. This game is made in a comic look and i like it ;) Hm, forgot to say there are golden keys available in this game to open a loot chest in sanctuary, which contains loot of your actual level. I started with 8 keys and you can find around the whole internet options to increase the number of keys to get some maybe good loot.Another Benefit from Digistruct Peak dlc is, after solving the histoty of simulated violence, you unlock overpowered lvl 1. On this difficult the complete game get a bit harder higher leveled enemies, but also better loot overpowered 1 items.After each overpowered lvl solved overpowered difficult can be raised at the main menu. The maximum overpowered lvl is 8. I played the whole game without any mods and so is the review about the game.If you want to help a friend getting overpowered lvl´s unlocked, your friend has to host the game.

content:
er 28, 2016
												I think this is probably one of the greatest ARPGs ever made. Technically an FPS-ARPG hybrid, this game combines a first person shooter interface with an ARPG style incremental loot hunt. This is also combined with a hilarious story, a vast array of ingenuous environments and Handsome Jack, the lead villain who is arguably one of the best video game antagonists every created.Game play revolves around killing bandits (and other monsters) indigenous to the fictitious planet Pandora. Pandora is a grim, frontier world, existing in a universe with a weak (or nonexistent central government) which has been a target for various attempts at corporate takeover. Most recently, it has been revealed as a place where ancient, alien treasure troves known as “Vaults” can be found. There are a host of well voiced, hilarious NPCs and supporting characters, an amusing story and plenty to shoot. Players can choose between four basic characters, with an additional two characters available as downloadable content. Each player character comes with its own special ability, allowing for a surprising variety of gameplay. This is an incredibly well done game that can provide hundreds, even thousands of hours of entertainment. Highly recommended for ARPG fans.

er 18, 2015
Well it's gearboxe's baby. The hot seller, but really is there a reason why? There sure is.Gameplay+ All just feel's finely polished.+ Many boss-battle's to be had.+ Looting from trash to spider's to mutant's.+ 4 fun character's & while even more with dlc's.+ Friendly A-i is actually good & provide's support.+ Many side-quest's with good humour here & around.+ Many character upgrade's such as slot,ammo,inventory increase.+ Wide-wide-wide range in equipment from shield's to relic's to what-not.+ Solid gunplay & good hit-box, oh my did i even say how much fun it is.+ Many variation in enemie's type's from bandit's to nomad's & alot-more.+ More than a thousand weapon-combination's, & all randomly generated.+ The game provide's a fair amount of dificulty, can be mostly challenging.+ One of the best,stylish game u-i to be had from the inventory to the map.+ Each character with it's own special charactistic's,upgrade's and what-not.+ All enemie's with many different basically approache's, some don't use cover like psycho's while other's do.- Easy way to do exploit's.- Some occasional A-i bug's.- Some death's can really feel cheap.- Weapon's & such aren't upgradable.- Many colution bug's and here around.- Many way's to farm enemie's &/or bosse's.Story+ Great,great dialogue.+ From funny to awesome.+ Literraly all vilian's speak up to directly.+ Each character has about just enough-backstory.+ Introduction vid's for bosse's & many character's. + It all get's it with just well making-sense & not making sense.NeutralControll's can collide a bit, such as if you're in a vehicle & want to go to another map you may just accidently get of the car if not facing directly as the button is same for that.Can be a bit demanding. ( At time's )If you only play just the main-mission's then you're gonna have a hard time beating enemie's due to the level-difference(s).Design( Graphic's )Included+ Just all pleasing to the eye.+ Great & stliyish and original from the menu to all.+ All enviroment's are well-designed & with fine graphic's.+ Character's are all well-modeled & spot on to psycho's and such.+ Map-design is great on, many type's of different terrian map's.Desert,snow,summer to alot more.- PhysX is broken and cause's incredible lag's.- Some texture/shadow lod problem's &/or draw distance problem.Sound's + OST+ All just awesome & correct.+ Sound-track can be chilly,tense and alot more.+ Well,well,well & great vioced character's to every villian,enemy and friendly.- There is a radio, which is bassicaly bare-bone's.......ConclusionIf you're looking for a just a fun,fun, & crazy shooter then this is for you. With a great-combat and gameplay,story,dialogue i see no reason not to buy it.Oh & if you're not buying it cause of fear that you must play the first 1 to understand the story, then you're completely wrong as there's already about enough back story here.===================================================================Click me and follow us as Curator

number of helpful: 19 of 24 people (79%) found this review helpful
content:
er 8, 2013
												«У них же были дети, родители, семьи… Как ты мог? Шучу. Убей их всех!»Да и могла ли атмосфера поменяться? События второй части разворачиваются на той же планете Пандоре всего через несколько лет после известного провала четверки охотников за Хранилищем. По пустынным равнинам все так же бегают скаги, в небе парят свободные ракки, а бандиты разбивают свои лагеря. Однако кое-что изменилось. Вскрытие героями Хранилища спровоцировало выход эридиума — сверхценного ресурса, на добычу которого направлена деятельность корпорации «Гиперион». Красавчик Джек, возглавивший «Гиперион», объявил политику очищения планеты от бандитской заразы колонистов, которые для совместного противостояния корпорации сплотились в местечке под названием Убежище. Таким образом, сюжетным фоном выступает классическая борьба могущественных, многочисленных, но «злых» эксплуататоров и слабых, но нравственно более одаренных повстанцев. В сюжетной завязке Borderlands 2 не блещет оригинальностью, повторяя каноническую схему многих антиутопических произведений. Тем не менее по ходу игры сюжет увлекает, нас ждут приятные и не очень неожиданности, которые проливают свет на события первой части.Система развития персонажа в Borderlands 2 не сильно отличается от оригинала. Уничтожая различную живность, а также выполняя задания, игрок получает опыт. Каждый новый уровень автоматически увеличивает максимальное здоровье и урон, а также дает одно очко умения, которое можно вложить в развитие того или иного навыка. У каждого из персонажей есть три специализации, представляющие собой набор тех или иных умений. Например, у убийцы Зеро это снайперское мастерство, хитрость, резня.Чтобы улучшить следующую ступень специализации, нужно вложить 5 очков в предыдущую. А таких ступеней у каждого персонажа шесть. Таким образом, чтобы дойти до вершины специализации, нужно иметь как минимум тридцатый уровень. А это значит, что можно стать или выдающимся снайпером, или крутым рубакой в ближнем бою, или всем понемногу.Что же касается боевой составляющей, то и с этой стороны игра похорошела.Плюсы: потрясающий стиль; фирменный юмор; колоритные герои; многообразие оружия.Минусы: система развития персонажа могла быть интересней.

												If Call of duty was a movie and Grand theft auto was a Gang fight, Borderlands was a circus.That's right, colorful and noisy circus.It's not trying to stir emotions, it's trying to entertain us.On borderlands 2 the circus is returning, bigger and funnier.But it's still the circus we know from 2009.Since the Vault opened at the end of the first game, it was discovered the miraculous element Haridium.Pandora has not become a better place to live.The new energy source attracted to the Planet the largest birds of prey in the galaxy, such as Hyperion technology corporation and its owners, known as Handsome Jack.Jack took over the planet with the help of armies of robots and his troops is threatening to destroy all opposition.He searches for Pandora's Box, another legendary Vault that supposed to give him absolute power over the entire planet and kills every vault Hunter that comes and may precede the Treasury.For those who not familiar with the series, Borderlands combines first-person action gameplay with a formula of a mass extermination, collecting loot and character development of role playing-action.I like to call it Shoot and Loot.The maps that make up the game's open world isn't random, but it will send you to kill thousands upon thousands of enemies, returning to life in most areas after a short time.Like I said, Borderlands 2 is a circus.Don't search for exciting moments & epic scenes.Come to the carnival (And don't forget to bring friends with you [Seriously, it's very boring to play alone]).

content:
ry 11, 2014
												I can already see myself getting attacked by lovers of this game for not recommending it. This is a game I actually hate, and I will explain why even though most of my arguments will be deemed invalid. I've spent a long time playing this game with a variety of friends I have, beat it once and played a lot of the True Vault Hunter and helped friends in different campaigns. As I write this review I'm level 40, I think the most fun I had out of this was surviving rounds with buddies in Fink's Slaughterhouse and riding some vehicles, other than that, the game has been extremely tedious and repetitive.Yes, I understand this is a RPG, and doing repetitive tasks is expected of one in the genre. However, my point stands because I believe there is a lot more to expect and to do on a big, open world like this. A lot of the dialogue, which are mostly done by characters that speak to each other through quirky one-liners, made me cringe due to how corny and/or annoying they were (Claptrap and Ellie being the biggest examples). It lacks polish too, as seen in the game's intro when played with multiple players, Claptrap addresses them as a single vault hunter, rather than multiple. It's something that shocked me a little, for a game that has its own proper and working co-op support, considering even Doom 3 on the original Xbox had dialogue acknowledging multiple players. But I digress, I was able to get a laugh out of very few lines, but I just couldn't find the majority of the ones my friends laughed at funny at all. On top of that the game throws a massive meme spam at you.Minor spoilers start here.One of the things that disappointed me the most about the game's ending, is how predictable it was. The final boss has a weak point that you just have to shoot a bunch of times for it to die/be damaged effectively, I've lost count of how many times this formula has been reused. There's next to no strategy in any of those, and zero entertainment. You just shoot them until they die, wasting a load of ammo, whilst going down a lot through the fight, sometimes even dying just to respawn in order to repeat the exact same process. Instead of going with a different and daring move that could've paid off and become very memorable, they went with the safest and dullest way.Minor spoilers end here.The A.I. in Borderlands 2 is the definition of dumb. They literally just charge at you and never bother to take cover or communicate any strategies, repeating the same tactic every single time. This made the game's combat beyond uninteresting and underachieving. It feels like their script is to really just lock on a target and shoot them regardless of anything that's happening. They don't try to defend themselves. They don't try to attack smartly. They just shoot or run at your direction to hit you (depending on the enemy), and that's it.I'm tired of characters that are nothing but quest distributors. While the quests have improved, they still use the same post-MMORPG find-and-fetch, or kill X number of a certain kind of affair code. It remains flat and boring to drive to a waypoint looking around for an item you’re supposed to retrieve while having a bunch of dreadful enemies to fight. Now about grinding, it's something that I will never understand how it can fun for people. You do the same monotonous crappy tasks for a tiring long amount of time to gain things that are hardly any better than what you had before. It's rarely ever worth the reward. There is literally no goal in MMORPGs other than the experience itself. You could argue that it feels rewarding achieving your goal after a long time spent working to get it, the counter-argument is that 95% of those rewards are worthless, and only take true effect and make a significant difference after a sluggish amount of deeds are done completing said tedious tasks.Furthermore, what really are the RPG elements in the game? Pondering over whether to sell a gun that does a certain amount of damage and has a percentage of this effect, or the other gun which deals more damage but doesn't have that effect but another is not role-playing. Neither is shopping for new class abilities with your new XP purchased skill point. Those things are micromanagement, not role-playing. In my eyes a game is a RPG when I feel that I am embodying a character. When you create a personality for the character and stick with it, making decisions based upon his/her beliefs, background, and such. Never once has this happened in Borderlands 2, so why is this considered an RPG? Simply having "RPG elements" like level progression, skill points to spend, getting better gear and the like really just doesn't to me make it an RPG game. I think the whole idea of 'role-playing' in a game context has become too blurry, and people are now misusing the term.Shops are stocked with the same kind of junk, and come with an occasional daily deal to tempt to you sell off your entire backpack. Clicking on Pandora’s countless lockers and storage boxes is borderline ennui. I don’t consider wandering around and picking up a valueless amount of money and a pack of ammo over and over again to be gameplay, and it’s doubtlessly not good gameplay. I nearly blench when I see a bunch of green lights from a distance, because I know that when I go there I'll get the same crap I always get and move on.It's the development road and sense of progression in the game that remains completely messed up. It’s too long, drawn out, and rewards perseverance and grinding rather than good playing and skill-building. Taking 5 levels to even unlock your character’s core class ability is also bothersome. It feels like you are constantly chasing a game-changing function that never materializes, and that is pretty much it. You’re non-stop attempting to advance or find a new and worthy gun, although when you do it’s just an unsatisfying incremental change. This game is empty, and to me, people are gleefully ignoring this as they run around opening boxes in the middle of shooting.At least, in cooperative, while talking to your friends about random subjects it's much easier to disregard the factors that make this game boredom, as it feels like it becomes a secondary. You tend to focus more on these during single-player. Obviously, there are things to praise about this game, such as the great art design. The voice acting is done with emotion and energy, which is something I adore. In the middle of unfunny nonsense there are some amusing things you can get a laugh out of, and clever references are also present. If you want to have a good time playing a mindless shooter that you can spend a lot of hours on and contains a lot of guns and quests with your friends, this indeed gets the job done. Looking at it as a game overall however, it is not good. I hope Gearbox improves Borderlands 3 upon this, since this one didn't from its predecessor. 4.1/10.0

content:
ber 8, 2014
												I have never played the original Borderlands. I decided to play Borderlands 2 to see what this franchise is like. I first noticed the cel-shaded graphics and a diverse number of characters to choose from. After I chose my protagonist (Gunzerker) I had to get used to the skill trees, the wacky characters, the large number of side missions in addition to the main story missions. One of the wackiest characters is Claptrap, a robot with something to say all the time and is quite delusional.The story is set in Pandora, a planet filled with vicious creatures of all kinds. The planet is control by Handsome Jack, the main antagonist of the game. As you progress through the game you will regularly hear Handsome Jack’s speak sarcastically about your goal to bring him down. There are many Echo recorders that will help flesh out the story and who Handsome Jack really is.The script and voice acting in Borderlands 2 is nothing short of superb. The voice actors and script writers should be highly commended for making the characters such as Scooter, Moxxi, Claptrap and others very entertaining. The only problem I found with the voices was that some conversations can be interrupted by other conversations before you can hear them completely. However, it’s not such a bad thing for the game overall.There is plenty to explore and if you’re into exploring as much as possible, Borderlands 2 will entertain you for 100+ hours. Each sector of the map has its own environmental feel and its own creatures. The DLCs add even more content for you to explore, but you are best advised to advance your character to at least level 20 because the enemies are much tougher than those enemies in the main story. The DLCs are divided into chapters and side missions while the battles with tougher creatures will reward you with lots of experience points. The side missions in the main game are definitely worth pursuing, as they include puzzle elements and some very simple goals such as simply shooting someone in the face in the side mission titled “Shoot This Guy in the Face.” Other side missions require you to find certain items to receive a unique weapon such as the side mission titled “The Lost Treasure”, a mission that requires you to find different parts of a treasure map. The parts can be anywhere in a region, but the payoff is huge in the form of a very powerful pistol.Part of what makes Borderlands 2 great in gameplay is the diverse availability of weapons, shields, grenade mods, class mods, and relics. Class mods and relics have ways of enhancing your character’s combat abilities. The inventory feels a little clunky, but once you get used to it you can navigate it pretty quickly. The inventory is important for using in the various vending machines for buying ammo, selling ammo and streamlining.Respawning is an integral part of this game, as enemies will respawn when you return to the same sector. It may feel tedious after a while, but it can be rewarding because these are opportunities to gain more experience as you try to reach the level of 50. To max out your character you will have to complete the normal mode in order to open up the True Vault Hunter Mode. It is important to know the strengths and weaknesses of enemies so that you know which weapons and ammo work best against them. For example, the loaders (mechanical bots) are vulnerable to corrosive ammo. Therefore, it is best to use a corrosive weapon to kill them faster. The crystallisks are hulking creatures with shins that are made of brittle crystals. Shooting their brittle shins is the only way to bring them down.This game encourages cooperative play, so it can be fun playing with friends. However, it is better to play with friends who are at a level close to yours, although the game automatically balances the difficulty according to the levels of the players. It is a great feeling trying to heal fellow players in dire times. The unusual feature of death is interesting because there is a chance to achieve a second wind if you get a kill while you’re dying and the red meter is going down to zero.I found the save system awkward since it saves everything that happens. If you leave the game while in the middle of a mission, you will have to pick up where you left off and the enemies you killed will respawn. In essence, the save system consists simply of save and quit.Borderlands 2 is one of the most entertaining role-playing games with so much to explore. The gameworld is thriving with loot and opportunities to reap the rewards of doing favors for other townsfolks. I highly recommend this game to anyone as it will take many, many hours of your time and those hours will feel worth it.

(not much better co-ops)6 different characters, different situations. Tasty! Skillfest. Lets rock! Lootfest. Juicy! Boomfest! GRRRRnades! Bosses. Badasses. Challenging difficulty. Catchy character-gameplay building (you can respec).The Siren is just awesome, enjoyin her all the time! The Assassin is very tricky with various gameplay, he rocks. Get the loadout editor software for exploring all the stunning arsenal!Comparing to the original, the more variety of enemies was needed and now its on. Also now fluent - action friendly walkthrough... enemy respawns now are slow; more resources, no major shopping dilemmas... Campaign DLCs also rock and have power to impress you and outshine the basic game.Large world overall. Lots of things to do. Secrets. High replayability. Humourous. Stylish. (over 12 million copies sold)

content:
er 20, 2014
												Overall, the art, narration and characters are really memorable. Considering I'm not much of an FPS fan (I haven't played BL1, note that), the number of hours I've put into this game is actually something I didn't plan out or expect.First to run through was pretty fun, and somewhere halfway around the second one (if not for the DLCs), the game start to drag a little bit on solo. I particularly liked how skills can be conveniently reset anytime along side with the large variety of weapons (gun porn~!). Trying out different builds made the game really interesting to play. I also like how some quests have quirky and funny storylines.If you're playing with friends, it's a great game to play! At this point in time, I don't think I'll be picking up BL2 again if I weren't playing with someone else. At higher levels, raid bosses get to be more frustrating than challenging, and the cycle of running through the same thing - griding and trying to score good loot just wears me out. I picked this game up on sale and bought it with friends, so the experience of laughing at Claptrap cursing stairs was really awesome. I would definitely say it's at least worth the money and worth playing.
