content:
er 29, 2016
DID YOU KNOW THAT OVER 97% OF ALL LIVING CREATURES ON PANDORA AREN'T EXPLODING RIGHT NOW?! This is one of the best COOP games I've ever played, heck even playing it Solo is fun enough (though, it can be tedious during some main quests). Released in 2012 and yet I'm still playing it in 2016: still have a lot to explore, achieve (you thought that getting all Steam achievements can be your end game, huh? How about in-game achievements, too?), level up (still having 1-2 characters to level up to max level and then getting all characters on the top of Overpowered level) and, of course, I still need to get MORE SHINY GUNS.Pros:+ Catching story line, and then -- BAM -- you get the DLCs for more! + more Side-quests!+ NPCs, their intros and VAs (seriously, just listen to Mr. Torgue). There's even the weapon manufactures commercials (check it out on YT)!+ Jokes, references, memes, Easter Eggs! Lots of them!+ Characters and their backstory.+ COOP, up to 4 players.+ Replayability: you have Normal + TVHM + UVHM modes to do and then, once you got Lv.72, you unlock OP1-8 levels +  Badass Tokens + [for hardcore perfectionists] you have in-game achievements in additional to Steam ones!+ Loot: a single item can get different levels, rarity, stats, weapon parts (that actually affect the weapon's stats!), mechanics etc.+ Explosions -- these are beautiful.+ Guns. Glorius guns. (while it's not the bazillion we've been teased about, there's still lots of them)+ OST -- varying from ambient to boss themes -- it's still eargasmic. Too bad that some of awesome tracks aren't listed in OST.+ Enemies. Ohhh I'm sure your most hated ones will be Juggernauts, Fire Threshers and Rabid Skags/Stalkers. Prepare to die & rage.+ Interesting mechanics: grenades that fire bullets?! A shotgun that fires swords that explode?! A shield that turns you into One-Punch Man?! GO GET IT. + with DLCs and updates you get more stuff, Pearlescent and Seraph with their own features.Cons (sadly, there are):- You can't start on higher difficulty if you already unlocked it. For every character you got you have to unlock and play through every Difficulty mode (Normal -> TVHM -> UVHM). Can be tedious and burning out if you don't speedrun through or not using save edit.- The game is about getting a better gear with each level you get. The grind. While I find it pretty OK-ish, some players may not like it.- The game isn't perfectly optimized, so you can experience FPS drops even on high-end PCs, but it's still worth it.- Easy to mod stats. You can encounter players with modded weapons or stats -- they can not only kill things by just looking at them but also drop some of their shinies ruining the fun for you (if you pick up the drops, it's all up to you).- Can be rough for Solo players (everytime you die the boss/enemies get their HP restored back to 100%)

												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding lemon bars recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1) 2 cups Flour2) 1/2 cup Sugar3) 1/4 teaspoon Salt4) 2 sticks (1 Cup) Salted Butter, Cut Into Small Cubes5) Filling6) 1-1/2 cup Sugar7) 1/4 cup Flour8) 4 whole Large Eggs9) Zest And Juice Of 4 Medium-sized Lemons10) Powdered Sugar, For SiftingDirections:1. For the crust: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9-by-13-inch pan with butter.2. Stir together the flour, sugar, and salt. Add the butter to the bowl and use a pastry cutter to cut it all together until the mixture resembles fine crumbs. Press into the prepared pan and bake until golden around the edges, about 20 minutes.3. For the filling: Stir together the sugar and flour. Crack in the eggs and whisk to combine. Add the lemon zest and juice and mix until combined. Pour over the crust and bake about 20 minutes.4. Allow to cool in the fridge for a minimum of 2 hours, then sift powdered sugar over the top before cutting into squares.(Use an 8 x 10 pan if you'd like the layers to be a little thicker.)

												Absolutely fantastic and thoroughly enjoyable!++ Wonderful character designs++ Great dialogue supported by excellent voice acting++ Unique skill trees even for what is essentially a shooter++ Numerous weapon and accessory varieties++ DLCs add a huge amount of content and replayability++ Extremely enjoyable single and co-op play++ Pop culture references galore (add nothing to a story but are always a nice touch)-- Repetitive mob and boss types-- Difficulty scales up in sheer brute force rather than combat intelligence or tactics-- Redundant kill, find, fetch, and delivery quests-- ClaptrapNot a lot of cons for me in this game. I'm just kidding about Claptrap. He is as funny as he is annoying (most of the time).I had the retail release of BL2 (and none of the mission packs and Vault Hunter upgrades at that time) way before I even became a Steam member. It's still as much fun now as it was back then. The DLCs add fresh content plus a good dose of hilarity, especially the Mechromancer and Tiny Tina's Assault on Dragon Keep!In terms of play and narrative, this is a very simple game at its core, but it's incredibly fun because it does it what it does with great polish, and the presentation is top-notch.

content:
er 26, 2013
												Borderlands 2 is not as good as the first game. Oh, sure, it's got a better (more emotional!) story, more diverse maps, more vehicles, a cool head and skin system, more gun types and effects, and is just all around a bigger, more varied experience, but it's not... well, okay. The first game wasn't a great shooter. Borderlands 2 isn't either. It mostly relies on simply pointing and clicking. The stats all ultimately determine how quickly an enemy's health bar diminishes in size. It's not as if we're playing Half-Life or Halo or FEAR or Bulletstorm or something, because we're not. We're playing a game that's about loot.Too bad the loot drop ratios are so bad. I don't know why they're worse than they were in the original game, but I do know that in my hundred-some hours of play, I only managed to pick up four or five orange items. That seems wrong. Borderlands 2 is the first game that made me seriously consider using CheatEngine. Me, I don't like cheats unless they're humorous, but Borderlands 2's drop ratios are so frustrating, requiring needless, endless grinding from players, that I found myself kinda going "yeah... let's make things more like they were in the first game."The story is great. I've mentioned that. I should mention it again. It's great. Best of all is Tiny Tina's Assault on Dragon Keep, which is apparently the only DLC developed entirely in-house at Gearbox (the others were apparently outsourced, which might suggest why they're all kind of terrible in terms of level design, pacing, and the like and only worth playing for the humor--Hammerlock's Hunt is easily the worst one), which actually kinda makes me feel emotions and stuff that I don't normally like feeling in video games.Borderlands 2 isn't a great loot game. It isn't a great shooter. It's a good-looking game, a glorious co-op experience, and is really funny to boot. Mister Torgue is a stand-out character; easily one of my favorites of all time. The new weapons and effects--if you're lucky enough to pick them up, are pretty cool. The game expands a lot of the elements of the first game, or tosses in a bunch of new things to make it more diverse. It's a fun game that's worth playing, but not because of its core gameplay mechanics, which are a bit of a letdown, or most of the DLC, which... honestly kinda sucks due to boring level design.

Public Review on behalf of the Opium Pulses Steam groupFew words about the gamePersonally it's my most favourite universe in whole... universe, yeah that makes sense. What can I say about the game, you're playing as a Vault Hunter, running around Pandora, which is planet where basically every living creature wants you dead. Great combination of first person shooter with roleplaying game. It can't get repetetive with over a gazillion of weapons and shields you can find.Advantages - Great story, dialogues, epic backstory of every single character - Awesome sense of humor fullfils whole story perfectly - Graphics are original and stylish, unique map design can be seen everywhere - Long, differential gameplay full of boss battles and hundreads of enemy types - 4 players coop, one of the best designed of all games - Perfectly selected soundtrack and ideally voiced characters - Moxxi ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)Disadvantages - Easy to exploit many aspects of game - From time to time there are problems with loading textures / shadows / long distances even with good setup - Disappointing in-game radio, i was hoping for more awesome songs to listen - There is kind of "need" to do side quests as You will have troubles to beat monsters / bosses due to level differences if You will go on fully by story missionsIf you find my review helpful or funny be sure to follow Opium Pulses curator page right here for more reviewed games!

number of helpful: 14 of 19 people (74%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
ber 11, 2015
												(Just humour me for a moment and pretend like you've somehow never heard of this game before) Hey, JacquesLeSauve, what's this Borderlands 2 game I keep hearing about?! Well, mister and/or miss random person gamer, since you ask!... Borderlands 2 is a first-person, co-op, loot-hunting shooter with RPG elements, and, it might surprise you to know, the sequel to Borderlands 1! (and technically the Pre-squeal, but that's kind of a grey area) Play through a lengthy campaign as one of four characters, each with their own unique abilities and upgradable skill trees to compliment those abilities. Complete quests, fight badasses, earn money, level up and explore the strange and wonderful world of Pandora, all the while searching for that hot new gun that's gonna seriously f*ck sh*t up and ruin everyone else's day. Sweet. The perfect antidote to an endless array of grey and brown shooters, this vibrant, cel-shaded style game refuses to take any part of itself seriously, save for the gameplay. Brimming with personality, it never misses a chance to hit the player with an off-colour joke or make fun of either itself or gaming in general, with a large portion of that magic being owed to the brilliant writing. The vast majority of characters fit into their roles perfectly and are expertly voiced as well, which is a huge breath of fresh air given how lacklustre the writing and acting can be in so many other games that have yet to learn how to feel natural or not completely chew up the scenery. OK, maybe the main villain is guilty of that heavy-handedness as he's so manifestly evil he goes beyond caricature or archetype and smacks of the creators trying way too hard to rile the player up and make them hate him. But even then he rarely outstays his welcome for too long. Gunplay is pretty much rock solid as everything feels like it behaves exactly the way it's supposed to, whether it's firing something big and heavy and primitive that makes a big boom, or something more elegant and finely balanced for those scalpel-like precision kills. Even reloading a weapon can feel immensely satisfying, between the reload animation itself or the nice, big clunking sounds of a clip being jammed into place... a sentence I never thought I'd hear myself say. Now I feel weird, like a freaky gun fetishist. Eurgh. But yeah, for a game all about shooting, this nails it for sure... even though I'm the type of player that likes to bring a knife to a gun fight. But either way, whatever you're into, this game has you covered. Speaking of having you covered, I really have to mention the online community. I'm not much one for online play typically, be it co-operatively or competitively, so not being massively familiar with it, I was a little apprehensive going into this, especially hearing horror stories about a few other communities, so I was expecting the worst. But I was really pleasantly surprised at just how nice and friendly and (mostly) competent the majority of other players seem to be. Sure, you'll occasionally get the odd palindromic loot tool come along and grab all the best gear for themselves, ignore other players in need, then talk cr*p about everyone else when no-one comes to their rescue. But in my experience most players here are incredibly nice and considerate and generous (I especially love the "loot fairies", players that randomly dropped into my game, threw a load of gear at my feet, then disappeared, never to be seen again) and many will happily chat with you if that's what you're into. I've even added some good people to my friends list off the back of this game. So if anybody's worried about that aspect of the game, they really needn't. If I had to make one major complaint about this it would be the opening. The bleak tundra setting of the first few hours really isn't very inviting or stimulating to the player and feels more like it should have been a mid to late game location rather than your introduction to the world, even for seasoned veterans of the first game. And, unfortunately, this is probably pretty unavoidable, given the nature of games where you have to level up, but you won't get any interesting gear for a while, either, and everything might initially feel really mundane for some players. But if you can push through it, then once you acquire newer, more interesting abilities and perks and expand your arsenal to include more exotic and outrageous gear, than that's when the game really starts to shine. So, with tons of replay value, between the multiple characters, two new game + modes and tons of additional DLC to purchase, whether you play this alone or with others, this is a game that should keep you busy and happy for a long, long time. So good is it, in fact, that after over 300 hours of play I'm still not tired of it and can't wait to see what they'll do for the third outing. Come get you one!

19, 2015
												First of all, I strongly recommend getting the Game of the Year edition if you can, for only a few bucks more during a sale, you get so much more DLC. If you don't get the GOTY edition, at least get the Tiny Tina DLC.The game is very cartoony and injects a lot of humor (sometimes dark) into the gameplay and dialogs. This game is a bit different from other FPSs in the sense that there are a lot of upgrades and level ups, and once you finish the main game, you can enter True Vault Hunter Mode, a harder version of the game where enemies are leveled up, and then again as Ultimate Vault Hunter mode, where enemies are even more scaled up. My only gripe with this game is that only legendary class weapons (the highest tier) become relevant later in the game, and you will pretty much sell/ignore all other drops, and there is no real money sink for you to spemd all your excess cash. Farming the legendaries can be brutal sometimes, where you can fight the same boss 100 times and still not receive a legendary drop. Still, I would rate this game as one of the top 3 games I've ever played.

content:
er 1, 2012
												Borderlands 2 is a blast in co-op, and an improvement over its predecessor in almost every way, but still retains that lonely, barren feeling when played solo.  Missions and environments are more varied and interesting; classes, skill trees and weapons are more fun; PC-specific improvements including adjustable FOV, better gamepad compatibility etc. Vanilla vs vanilla it decimates the original Borderlands. There isn't as much enemy variety as I would've liked and, while the environments are more varied, they're still mostly limited to inherently barren environments (ice, desert, wastelands).  I would've liked to see more lush environments but perhaps this is being/will be addressed in the DLC.  There are minor bugs like your loot falling through the earth along with real problems such as inventory space being extremely limited, considering it's a loot game.  In spite of this, the game is polished and solid all the way through.One of the top quality games of the year; got the nasty taste of Diablo 3 out of my mouth. Highly recommended if you plan on co-op.

r 6, 2015
												So, a few years after the FIRST Borderlands came out, I developed a deep hatred for it. I though it looked stupid. I still haven't played the first one to this day (I missed the sale), but I grabbed this mainly because a friend said we could play together (we have not since).But hey, part of what makes me LOVE this game so much is because SO many people still actively play it. I swear, every time I've started playing, and sometime during the session, one of my friends asks if they can join my game and/or I can join theirs. Some people don't intend on making me feel like a noob—though they do and I'm okay with it/don't say anything—but it's so fun! The game has the most unique online systems I've ever seen IN a video game, and everyone just has a ton of fun~The game itself is very similar to Bioshock (thanks 2K) in the means of shooting, crazy-♥♥♥ weapons (MUCH more so here) and looting. A LOT of looting. You could spend hours in the game literally making little progress, but looting EVERY container you can find, and there are plenty of secrets to find, too! I'm sure those secrets go with a few achievments, but again, if you don't want to spend hours...they're just achievemnts, dude; I know it's hard to resist, but it really can get tiring looting everything.The game's got a LOT of humor, and a LOT of unique storyteling/characters that help with that. It's an experience EVERYONE deserves to enjoy. And I feel bad I looked at this franchise the wrong way at first.

number of helpful: 10 of 12 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
7, 2014
												Borderlands 2: Probably the best game I've ever gotten from a friend. (Thanks [A.C.E] ACEALEC︻デ═一 for getting me this game) It combines the good parts of shooters, with an impressive, dark story, and also some amazing characters. I usually keep this stuff towards the end, but I'm gonna be honest with you: This is probably one of the finest games of last generation. To the review!GraphicsThe visuals were annoying at first and still are, but I began to grow into the comic styled visuals and then thought it looked great. However, some enemies had poor textures along with lots of the environment. The characters look great, the buildings look awesome, but the environments, many of the enemies (Not all, though. Some look great) have odd textures or look poorly done. When it comes to comic graphics, it's either a hit or a miss. I say Borderlands 2 was successful, but I can't say that it was out of the park good. Overall though, I like it.GameplayThe gameplay, which is tied for first as Borderlands 2's (BL2 for short) strong point, takes the "good parts of shooters" and along with countless loot, class combinations, several RPG elements, etc, and makes some strong gameplay. The gunplay is heated along with the special ability each class has, the fights are even more intense. All of the characters are pretty balanced, heck, even Axton (The Commando) is pretty balanced for a guy who has a sentry who does the work. However, since I used to play quite a bit of Salvador (The Gunzerker) seems a bit weak, His ability is good, but it isn't as useful as the Siren's, the Assassin's, and the others. He could use a small buff. Ironic, too. He actually did lots of steroids. Must be karma or something. Don't do drugs, kids! Oh wait, I'm getting off topic. Excuse me for that. Anyway, the vehicles in BL2 are good enough, but maybe a few more different vehicles would've been better. Either way, going around and running over Psychos is good fun. The world is large and there's lots to explore, too. I love this game's gameplay. StoryThe story was done right and makes most shooters look bad. It isn't top notch like Spec Ops: The Line (Which was also released in 2012) or Mass Effect (When a game has a better story than Mass Effect, you KNOW it's good) but it's able to satisfy me. The writing has a dark tone to it, but at the same time, there is some funny moments that try to cheer you up in the hostile world of Pandora. I'm not going to spoil it, but if you've played Borderlands 1, there will be a moment towards the end of the game where your heart will just break. There are some strong plot twists that greatly affect the story greatly and make the huge 90 degree turns worth it. The humor is a bit rushed, but I still laughed out loud many times. Claptrap and Handsome Jack are the two guys who basically lead the whole story. Claptrap is always funny, and even Handsome Jack is humorous a lot. However, Handsome Jack starts to show that this "loving to hate him" thing is really starting to kick in at a certain point in the game. He goes flat-out revenge and really makes him a strong character and also one of the best villains I've ever encountered in a video game, rivaling GLaDOS and others. The four main characters (and DLC characters, making it six) are all good, but again, Salvador is a bit one dimensional. Either way, don't underrestimate this game's story.AudioThe audio is great, and the voice actors did an outstanding job. Handsome Jack is definitely the strong point and is able to prove that he is a terrifying (yet awesome) villain. The music is great and fits in with the atmosphere perfectly. Not much to say other than Handsome Jack played his role well.ReplayabilityThe replayability, if it isn't obvious enough, is tied with the gameplay for the #1 strong point of the game. I'll try not to make this part too long, so yeah. Here we go: There are TONS of DLCs to buy, you can try to beat the game with another class, try another playstyle, help a few friends, get some new customizable skins, get the legendary weapons, find all the easter eggs, and lots, lots, lots, lots more. Should I say anything else to back up the fact this game has some pretty strong replayability? No? Good.VerdictIn the end, Borderlands 2 proves that it is one of the best shooters of last generation and is one of my personal favorite shooters now. It does something few shooters actually do, which is have a strong story. The great gameplay, amazing replayability, detailed characters, and funny writing all make this game a true masterpiece any shooter fan should have in their library. So, newbie Vault Hunters. Are you ready to go shoot, loot, and loot some more?Graphics- 7/10Gameplay- 9.5/10Story- 9.5/10Audio- 8/10Replayability- 10/10.:8.8/10:.+Amazing story+Outstanding gameplay+Unforgettable villain+Detailed characters+High replayability+Easily one of the best co-op games out there-Textures poorly done on occasion-More vehicle choices-Some rushed humor moments

content:
, 2013
												Borderlands was great, Borderlands 2 is just amazing. There are so many easter eggs, secrets and shout outs to movies that I likely will never find them all.  I played as the Hunter on 1, Zero on 2 as, I guess I am a distant sort and would rather take em out from so far off that the one next to them wonders where that came from.  But really the game play is very good, has many things to make you laugh, and some sad. BUY IT NOW! LOLEdit:I have 2,760 hours in now.  Time to add some infoAt the time I did this I had only played Zer0, with practice he is a force to be reckoned with.Now, I gravitate to Gaige, the Mechromancer because, anarchy forever LOL  Early play her "pet" Deathtrap is killer and helps a lot, once I get the skill close enough and the skill Anarchy things get interestingMaya, awesome support but a power house in her own right, cloud kill, baaahahahahahaa, phase lock.Axton, well rounded out solder type, not my fave but he is balanced pretty well.Krieg (Psycho class), for up close melee, this is on the edge of your seat fast paced action.  Once you unlock Release the beast, if you can work with it you can be a runway train.Salvador, the Gunzerker.  If you manage to get the right guns, class mod and relic, he is pretty much a tank.  So much so that some find him boring, I think he is fun but not my fave (see Mechromance above).If you get the GOTY + Ultimate Vault Hunter Upgrade pack 2 and the five head hunter packs you have it all, and I can honestly say hundreds of hours game playEven my least favorite of the four main campaign DLC (NONE are in the main story, they have their own stories and maps) is good, my fave (Tiny Tina's Attack on Draggonkeep, an AD&D inspired story) is awesome.The game has it's issues, but the good out weighs it by a lot.PhysX is badly implemented and appears to work better on old NVIDIA cards (from 2011) than new ones.  PhysX if not on low causes loot to fall through the floor/ground in some places as well as poor frame rate.If you are not trying to use PhysX the game can run on fairly low end hardware.Borderlands, is was/is a good game, but this one (Borderlands 2) in spite of it's problems is just an amazing game.  If you like ARPGs and FPS then I think you should give this one a go.

ry 14, 2014
												The game that keeps on giving. Borderlands 2 is a loud, colourful mess of shooting, looting, idiocy and even more idiocy, and is one of the finest multiplayer experiences I know. It's made even more addictive by the extensive RPG elements.If you have Nvidia PhysX available, you ought to enable it because Gearbox have really made use of it in Borderlands 2. Fight scenes become a cacophonous rainbow of silliness that leave you craving more every time.They really missed a trick when it comes to weapons though. There are countless weapons in the game but they can't really be customised with scopes, suppressors or elemental effects. If you find a weapon, you can either take it or leave it. Here's hoping Borderlands 3 will address that issue and allow players to piece together the perfect loadout for their play style.If you are looking for realism in your shooters, try elsewhere, but if all you want is NGHGHHYEAHHH then Borderlands 2 is for you.

												It seems crass to judge a game by quantity, but this is quantity of quality. Despite its flaws it really is some of the best co-op gaming you're likely to see in recent years, if you like piles of guns, lots to do and shoot, and a robust leveling system with a natural coop multi-player aspect and aren't put off by the cel shading, it's a no-brainer. 8½/10

content:
y 24, 2016
												Borderlands 2 is a big game. The sprawling cooperative shooter has arrived, delivering long hours of shooting, looting, and butt jokes. Well, almost intact. Game design changes, like changing the enemy death animations, do a good job of cutting corners while preserving the core action. Technical shortcomings, however, leave little doubt that this is the lesser version of Gearbox's great sequel. Dialogue and sound effects frequently sound flat and occasionally disappear, while the frame rate often slows down in combat and makes the chaotic action feel unwieldy.Combat in Borderlands 2 is naturally a bit floaty and loose, largely due to way player movement and enemy behavior are paced. As a result, it can accommodate the small degree of control imprecision added by the touchscreens and be none the worse for it. Likewise, the smaller range of motion of the analog sticks may cause some making the PC/console transition to balk a bit, and indeed, aiming can initially feel ungainly if you're used to the game on other platforms. After you adjust the aim sensitivity and spend some time wandering the wastelands, however, the mercenary satisfactions of long-range headshots and up-close bullet barrages are well within reach.Pros:Its a good game +Long story +wide variety of guns +Large World +Cons:You have to be on the same level to play together (in some cases only) (Multiplayer)Character skills menu is broken (Skills menu)In skills menu Main Protagonist is invisible, sometimes loads after some mins (Skills menu)My ratings,8.5/10 :)

												What can i say about this game. I Can't stop playing it. I already had this game on PS3 with around 200 hours on there, and when it came on sale on steam i couldn't resist. An FPS/RPG/Co-op game, you can play with your friends, play single player, or play online, and i can guarantee you won't get bored. Thousands of weapons leaves choices open to how you want to play, and with 6 utterly different classes to choose from, there are a number of awesome, fun ways to play.I had bought Borderlands 1 a few months after it came out and played it for many hours, completeing the game on 2 characters, and i enjoyed it so much, when i saw that they were releasing Borderlands 2 i honestly thought that it couldn't get any better. Well they made it better all right. If you have have played number 1 or if you havn't then i still highly recommend this game.The storyline is brilliant, funny, and a lot of fun. Some of the characters are hilarious and brilliantly thought out, and the story will keep you laughing all the way. The graphics and excellent, with a mix of cartoony and realism all mixed in, much like Borderlands 1. The gameplay is also fantastic, with so many different ways to kill enemys and different playstyles. One of the best games i have ever played.10/10 from me, highly recommend!

number of helpful: 6 of 6 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
7, 2015
												Borderlands 2 like its predecessor is a role playing shooter. You begin your adventure as the victim of train sabotage by Handsome Jack. And awaken from catastrophe relatively unscathed at the feet of Claptrap. Claptrap eventually leads you to resistance against Handsome Jack, led by the original four characters from Borderlands. The story has seen improvement over the original. The quality writing as a whole has drastically increased from first insulation, but it’s made not for story structure but in the dialog as well. From the dialog alone, I predict that Handsome Jack will start appearing top 10 favorite villain list over the internet sometimes soon. He has a great personality, his funny human and ultimately very very evil.The journey will rack you-in over 30 hours to complete the main quest line. That’s if you don’t do any side missions, go off exploring, team up with friends and their games. Borderlands 2 is a time enthralling but I mean the most enduring way possible. No matter if you catch the game on sale or if you pay full price, you will get your money’s worth. It’s jam packed with quality content from start to finish. If I use the term “finish” likely because once you complete the main quest, you can play thru the entirely game again against harder and more diverse enemies that drop more elaborate guns and gear pushing you seemingly temporary cap of level fifty. In that regard, Borderlands 2 is like an MMO but one you only experience with friends and strangers if you want to. Teaming up with your friends and strangers is as easy as flickering on light switch. Cooperative gameplay not only exponentially increases the fun factor with your friends, but it also causes the game to spawn tougher enemies and better loot. There are plenty of bad-♥♥♥ awards, permanent perks for performing various in-game task that can only be achieve with help from your friends.Graphically, Borderlands 2 has seen a significant facelift over the original but still uses the same art style. I ran on several different graphics but somehow hard time pushing few of the games more fantastic effects when there was tons of actions on the screen. But all in all, I am very pleased that way the game performed. I experienced very few crashes and my connectivity issues were hammered out by the third day of gameplay. The varied locations grade from deserts, to rocky mountain ranges, to green steps, to snowy wastelands, to urban environments and industrial complexes located in the world’s harshest terrain. You’ll be fighting classic enemies like skag, rakk and pyscho but there is also nice variety of new beast, malcontents and machines.Getting from point A to Z in Borderlands 2, can be done either by foot, car or fast travel stations. Considering the massive size of the entire world, you’ll be happy for any type of transportation after a particularly grew some firefight session. It is important to note that driving cars on PC, takes some getting used to. But most of all, I am slightly disappointed to see that enemies clearly have air superiority over you with transforming robots and buzzard drop ships. This isn’t necessarily negative mark against Borderlands 2 or a side note. I really really want to fly those buzzards around in the available areas within Pandora. Despite everything I love about Borderlands 2, it definitely has an ugly side to it. Unfortunately, it comes from the multiplayer. Joining cooperative games which I haul hardly recommend on doing. It can have some massively negative repercussions to your single player experience. You can miss entire chunks of the storyline and game important unlocks by hopping on with players who are only few levels ahead of you depending where you are in the game. Even though Borderlands 2 offers a system to counter this possibility, it’s not 100% effective. And sadly, there is no Replay Mission option available which could potentially resolve this issue entirely.I love Borderlands 2 and truly love it. Certainly, there are few dense in the hall but all in all its exemplary experience from start to finish whether you play along or with friends. I can easily say one of the best cooperative games I’ve played this generation and easily one of my favorite first person shooter as well.

content:
ry 6, 2014
												This game, despite not having better graphical quality than other RPG games, it is one of the best games I've played. The fact that the game's setting which takes place in the years 5252 does not convince me much about the technological advancement as compared to the present (other than the fact that you can download your own vehicle from any catch-a-ride machine), but Gearbox's most famed game is not just an awesome game, it's beyond that. There are 3 playthrough modes, 6 characters to play on, and thousands of different variants of weapons to choose from. And then there are unique weapons, which signifies that these weapons will act in a unique way upon being fired, rather than just having its bullets fired in a straight line. Normal Mode was relaxing and enjoyable, TVHM was more intense, and UVHM (including the Overpower levels) is tougher and is recommended for hardcore gamers. I could go on, but this is truly an awesome, must-play game. Hats off to the game developers.

												Important information for first time borderlands players--The GOTY edition comes with all 4 campaign DLC, 2 playable character DLC and ONE of the level cap upgrade DLC (UVHM pack 1 specifically). This means that all GOTY players will have a level cap of 61.-If you want full immersion, I recommend you purchase the GOTY and then UVHM Pack 2: DIgistruct peak separately. This increases your level cap to 72 and gives access to 8 OP levels which you could research about.-The 5 Headhunter packs do NOT offer new weapons, but each are worth a couple hours of content and are still fun to play around with for their price if you want the complete intended experience.-The game itself is amazing and is regarded as an essential title according to many gamers.

content:
5, 2015
												Borderlands 2 is cross between an RPG regarding the story and a FPS for the action and levelling system.With randomly generated guns, shields, class & grenade mods, the variation of equipments is staggering, much like the enemies.From Psycho Midgets holding shotguns bigger than them (that have the most hilarious lines ever written), robots with everything from pistols to nukes, local wildlife that can lob cars at you or tunnel underground and appear with a fiery explosion and a swarm of tentacle like arms to various boss's & a hole host of creatures, humans & AI mechs, under, on or above the surface of Pandora. Which by the way is a beautifully place.The environment ranges from glaciers, valleys, deserts, roaming hills, caverns, towns & with the expansions even more including a vast landscape produced by a 13year old explosives genius mind, Tiny Tina. A character I hope you will come to love as most of us have.The main story is brilliant and take you all over Pandora. You can play solo or with up to 3 others, from 1 of 4-6 (DLC dependant) Vault hunters. All with unique abilities, and skill trees that can be changed throughout the game to suite your play style & equipment. The vast number of optional side missions can provide some very nice loot, insights into the life & history of Pandora or just a good laugh.The main DLC's (Psycho, Mechromancer, Ultimate Vault Hunter Upgrades 1 & 2, Mr. Torgue's, Sir Hammerlock's, Captain Scarlett & best of all Tiny Tina's) are all worth the coin, the head hunter packs are ok, and the skins are all superficial. But to be fair now the GOTY Edition is out id just get that, then you have the lot, it's so worth it. I'm on 1000+ hours and still coming back to it.Edit: Spelling10/10

content:
12, 2014
												Shooting games aren't usually my cup of tea but then there's Borderlands. The first game was a game that I sunk a large number of hours into (steam lies) because of how much fun it offered, Borderlands 2 takes everything that the first game has to the next level and adds even more.The characters in the game have amusing dialogue that is rather funny and interesting, each has a different style and a unique personality, whether it's Cl4P-TP, Scooter, Handsome Jack or any of the many other character you'll encounter throughout the many adventures on Pandora.While missions are usually to kill other creatures there's still a large diversity and I never felt that I was doing the same thing except for maybe some of the missions in the Sir Hammerlock's Big Game Hunt DLC.The game offers a number of DLCs and while that could be bad practice I have to give them credit for at least 2 of the main DLCs: Captain Scarlett and Her Pirate's Booty, and Tiny Tina's Assault on Dragon Keep for being excellent (I can even go as far as saying that Tiny Tina's Assault on Dragon Keep is beyond excellent and because of it Borderlands 2 is now my favorite game). Mr. Torgue's Campaign of Carnage DLC is good fun, and Sir Hammerlock’s Big Game Hunt has its strong points but has some bad ones as well.The game provides an interesting story line as opposed to its predecessor in addtion to connecting it to what little of story the first one did. There are moments of pure nostalgia for Borderlands fans, as well as plenty of easter eggs and references to all kind of different games, movies, and TV shows that kept me smiling throughout the game.The game has very high replayability value, aside from 6 unique classes each class can be played in many different styles thanks to the massive number of different weapons and skills combinations, and the addition of the badass rank and badass tokens with the large collection of challenges, it also helps that the scenery and lighting ingame are impressive and beautiful to look at. Exploring everything and taking my time to finish most challenges I already have over 100 hours on a single character and I'm not yet done with all the DLCs on the Normal Mode, I still have many more hours before I even start True Vault Hunter Mode and Ultimate Vault Hunter Mode on that character alone.

content:
, 2014
												When I first saw Borderlands I thought: this is not my cup of tea. But guess what, when something goes on sale it gets more attractive so yeah, i bought it for a ridiculously low price and gave it a chance.The game is quite repetitive, the "million weapons" exist only in stats (really unsatisfying) but the game is still not boring for some reason. The "story" was something I did not care about (which is surprising because mostly the story is the reason why I pick up a game), many people say it's awesome but for only few character was interesting so this game was a "shooter" for me. The voice acting, sounds and music is great in this game alongside the world. Also, the UI is pretty great as well but most people don't give a thought on this one.Ohh, and this game does the ugliest thing in the FPS history: spawning enemies in the back. That was so so so o frustrating, I was like "not again..." for almost the whole game. After almost 70 hours I left the game with the feeling of incompletion (even though I finished every main and side mission) and frustration. I played through because I thought I'll feel that good feeling when you complete a game, but there was nothing, just emptiness.I have mixed feelings about recommending this game but it definately worth a try, it can be interesting for a while and it's pretty fun with friends.

content:
ry 2
												If you don't mind beating the main story and selected quest (with best rewards) over and over and over again (though each time with higher difficulty, with opportunity for rarer loot, more skill points or just starting a completely different character), grinding for best loot available, take on raid bosses or simply have a fully supported co-op (up to 4 players) experience, the game's definitely for you. It might become a bit challenging on UVHM difficulty (3rd playthrough) for some so just remember to spam special abilities often and slag enemies as frequent as possible. Optionally, take advantage of skill/gear guides or better yet - beat this mode cooperatively. Grab the GOTY edition on Steam sale (roughly €10) + UVH Upgrade 2 for the most badass experience ever!

In the game we can play as one of four main characters: Salvador (gunzerker), Maya (siren), Zero (assasin) and Axton (commando). Fields after whose will also move us are very large. The game has a very pretty graphic and very good sound. Creators also offer cooperative mode for a four people and a very nice DLC packages which adds many hours of fun. I highly recommend this game, gameplay is a very funny. My final rating is 9/10.

content:
er 29, 2013
												Borderlands 2 attempts to step up from the first game, but in the end they don't deviate much from the original setup. There's guns, loot, ridiculous characters, and EXPLOSIONS.One thing I enjoyed, is that this game is just a heck of a lot more FUN. The voiceovers are great, some of the characters will bust your gut (Torque and Tiny Tina), and the ongoing lines from Jack always tow the line between seriously-going-to-kill-you and I-need-to-crack-a-joke territory.The controls and gameplay are solid once again, and I had a relatively bug free experience on the PC. If you are an achievement hound, get ready for a few achievements that will drive you batty. The Challenge Accepted achievement takes more time to complete than the main campaign does, but man does it feel good to land it.My biggest complaint with the Borderlands series continues to be with how stinkin' easy the game is. Yes, they added Ultimate Vault Hunter mode and made the baddies better (also the overleveling DLC), but I'm concerned with the original campaign. I want my first playthrough to be challenging. It took me all of a minute to defeat the final boss on my first playthrough, do you know how unsatisfying that is? Instead of building the game around a pre-set structure of levels for opponents, why not structure the first playthrough where all enemies level up with you? Nothing is worse than coasting through the final mission while shooting a gun that's ten levels above your worst enemy.Overall, it's a game that's very fun to play and has reasonable replay value, but you won't find many surprises here if you played the first.

number of helpful: 13 of 20 people (65%) found this review helpful
content:
3, 2014
												Borderlands 2 is a very mixed bag. At times, it can be incredibly fun, as you unload shotgun pellets into Psycho Midget faces and throw buzz axes at a Goliath's head. At other times, it can be an incredibly tedious game as you backtrack from place to place and are forced to perform some infurating timed quests. The same can be said for its juvenile sense of humor. At times, it can be a very funny game, but at plentyof other times, you'll groan at how dumb a joke was or how awful a reference was. Let's get the biggest issue out of the way first. This game is terribly boring in the first couple of hours. You barely have any variety in combat, you have very few and very weak weapons, and you don't really have any interesting quests. It's a slog through the campaign until you get enough skill points in your character to make the game fun. For example, in my playthrough as Krieg the Psycho, it was a boring experience until I got enough points in cooldown reductino to let me spam my active ability freely. And on that note, we look at another big flaw of Borderlands 2: the skill tree. Every character gets only one active skill, such as being able to dual wield guns, turn invisible, or summon a giant mech of death. While this improves the variety of combat greatly at first, you don't get any of the more interesting or game changing abilities until your character is at a very high level (31 or more). Until then, you're stuck with (mostly) boring percentage stat boosts that barely affect your playstyle. To the game's credit, there are a hanful of interesting skills that do change how you play significantly, but there aren't enough of them. If there was more than one active skill, then the skill tree would be a little more tolerable, but as it stands, it's a grind to get the skills that you actually want. Next on the chopping block is the music and gun sounds. The guns, more often than not, sounds incredibly weak. You often feel like you're firing a peashooter, not a quad barreled shotgun. It's all incredibly underwhelming, to be honest. The music is fine, but it does a very poor job of pumping your adrenaline. That is, the music never helps you feel like the badass that the game wants you to be. My next major complaint is the loot system, in that it's not very good. There are some interesting weapons and drops, but more often than not, you'll get crappy guns that you'll just throw away because they're too weak or underleveled. This wouldn't be so bad if guns scaled to your current level, but since they don't, you'll be getting a lot of trash in proportion to useful equipment. Also, the performance of this game is not very consistent. At times, I can get 120 FPS no problem, but when I turn 180 degrees, it become a quarter of what it was a second ago. After trying numerous engien tweaks and reducing graphical fidelity, not much improves the performance of this game (I run a 780 Ti, so it's a very capable rig). It's not a dealbreaking, but it is very annoying.  Finally, the story is very threadbare, despite Gearbox's efforts to improve it this time around. The entire story can be summed up to: Handsome Jack is a ♥♥♥♥, go kill Jack. I mean, the story does its job in getting you from place to place and ferrying you to a wide variety of locales, but it really isn't anything memorable. So, now onto the good. The combat can be really fun late game when your character is properly specced out. Having a maxed out Mania tree in Krieg is a blast as you one shot enemies with your melee weapon or snipe them from afar with your thrown buzz axes. You'll eventually get some interesting guns that have some very powerful effects that mesh with your playstyle or change it up. Co-op is pretty seamlessand allows you to drop into and out of a friend's game quickly. Enemies will become tougher, and loot will become better, so it's definitely the way to play if you have a couple of good buddies. The voice acting, in general, is very well done. Solid deliveries by the cast all around, and there are some very well delivered lines (pretty much anything by Handsome Jack is well voiced, for example). There really aren't any characters that get get on your nerves, unless you find Ashley Burch's voice grating. Finally, the game can be incredibly funny in its own stupid way. If you embrace the cheese of the game and accept stupid jokes like "bonerfarts", then you're going to have a good time. However, it should be known that this game relies entirely on crass humor, so if you don't like that sort of thing, you will not enjoy the humor whatsoever. So, in conclusion, Borderlands 2 is a very slow burner because of its poor skill tree and loot system, but it picks up later on in the game as you get more interesting loot and skills. It's definitely great as a co-op game, but it's a fun experience too if you play solo.

content:
ber 24, 2014
												A combination of first person shooter and role playing game, Borderlands 2 is an addictive mix of genres that will suck away thousands of hours of your time. The cell shading art style is different - but beautiful - and can be removed with a minor tweak in the config files if you want to take it off for a small increase in performance. Removing the cell shading does not detract from the beauty of the game, just changing it slightly.The storyline, voice work, and pace of the game are all fantastic. And I loved the humour and subtle (and some not so subtle) jokes throughout. Not much else can be said about it without giving too much away.I would highly recommend purchasing the Game Of The Year edition and playing through the game as each of the characters to explore the differing fight mechanics that come with them. Go in guns blazing as a Gunzerker, or sneak in as an Assassin; the choice is yours. There are a few more characters and others ways to deal with enemies, and those methods will keep you busy for a long time in this game as you explore the world anew each time.Although many of the side quests are not mandatory, they are recommended to be completed to gain experience to be able to progress through the story missions without having to empty hundreds of rounds of ammo into enemies. If you try to run through the story as fast as possible, you will find yourself coming across enemies many levels above your own, and you will die, a lot.If you like first person shooters, you'll like this game. If you like 4 player co-op with friends, you'll like this game. And if you want a game that provides a lot of content that is good value for money, you'll like this game (GOTY Edition, anyway).

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
er 22, 2013
												You have to reeeeeeeeeeeeeally love Borderlands to get the most out of this one. Otherwise you just get sick of it relatively quickly like I did. Even still, you may think you love Borderlands a lot after playing the first one, and think you'll really love this one too, and then realize that maybe you don't like it as much as you thought.Objectively speaking, everything about BL2 is better than the first. It's incredibly polished, loaded with content, easier to play with friends (or strangers), highly replayable (that is, if you reeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeally love Borderlands). So much improvement, but just not as addicting. Exploring is pointless because there's nothing to find, and the only good weapons come from grinding bosses. I just couldn't get hooked like I did on the first one.Mostly fun while it lasted, but I'm so bored of it all, and it's feeling like a chore just forcing myself to finish the last (and apparently best) DLC. The humor is enjoyable too, I suppose, but it quickly becomes predictable.All in all, I'm in a strange place with this recommendation. If I could go back in time and tell myself not to get it and that I wouldn't enjoy it as much, past-me wouldn't believe future-me and would still buy this game and it's DLC anyway. I can't say I regret the 107 hours spent playing this game, but I can't say it was time well spent either.Curiosity satisfied, Borderlands hunger satiated, that's it for me. Thanks Gearbox and 2K, but I won't be getting BL3.

content:
ry 22, 2014
												This is more of an addictive hobby than a game.  Take the old Doom games, update the graphics with a cartoony look and then throw in a great story and some RPG elements and you have Borderlands 2.  The loot in the game is maybe the most addictive feature, the items you acquire can be great but they loose their luster (and power) as you level up so you are constantly searching for better gear and items... this leads to playing the game in search of legendary items (loot midgets anyone?) at higher and higher levels.  Each character can play through the game three times (more really, since you can reset your progress in Ultimate Vault Hunter Mode, if you get that far) and with all the DLC available for this game, that means hundreds of hours of gameplay.  If you're an addict of the game like me, get all the DLC for it including the headhunter stuff because it all contributes to the greatness of Borderlands 2.  I've mainly played as Gaige but I've also tried out the Gunzerker too.  I've sunk over 200+ hours into the game as of the writing of this review and I'm still looking forward to playing as the Siren and the Psycho.  Be warned... if you get into the this game, I mean really get into it, you'll have a long stay on Pandora and the real world will become a serious nuisance because it will limit your ability to play Borderlands 2.

content:
ry 15, 2014
												The game is set 5 years after the original Borderlands, on the planet Pandora. Handsome Jack, the leader of the Hyperion Corporation (Borderlands 2's main antagonist), claimed responsibility for the opening of the vault and the killing of The Destroyer which the four original vault hunters; Roland (Soldier), Lilith (Siren), Brick (Berserker) and Mordecai (Hunter) {The original vault hunters are NPCs in Borderlands 2} had done under guidence from "Guardian Angel". Handsome Jack declared himself dictator of Pandora.You play as a new group of Vault Hunters; Axton (Commando), Maya (Siren), Zer0 (Assassin), Salvador (Gunzerker), Gaige (Mechromancer) and Krieg (Psycho) {Note - The Mechromancer and Psycho classes are DLC and have to be brought}. The new vault hunters are tasked with killing Jack and restoring order back to Pandora.The game itself is a First-Person Role Playing Shooter, It relies heavily on loot, the game is all about grinding to become a god, getting to the highest level and getting the best gear, Co-Op is a huge part in Borderlands and makes the game 20x more fun with otters. Borderlands 2 has good comedy in it too, just silly little things that make you laugh.Borderlands 2 is really good!, it is really fun with some friends and with all the DLC that is out, you will have hours and hours of fun.

content:
2, 2014
												What a fantastic game!  While the experience is much better if you can round up a couple of friends, this game is still very much enjoyable as a single player experience.  I have easily logged over 100+ hours on this game on console, both as single player and as multiplayer.  Combining the fast paced action of a first person shooter with the addictive nature of leveling and loot finding from an rpg, Borderlands 2 is a new beast altogether.  Add in a competent story and this game will suck you in for dozens of hours.  Even if you're not a big shooter fan I would say give this a try, as it relies less on twitch gaming and more on planning and strategy.  With multiple classes that play differently, this is a game that you could easily play through more than once.  Solid controls and soundtrack only add to the experience.  Overall, this is one of the best gaming experiences you can have this generation.  I give this game a 9/10.

												Loot and Shoot has never been better. Honestly I have no idea why I didn't get into the Borderlands franchise sooner. This game took everything that was amazing with the first Borderlands and made it 100x MORE BADASS! The characters are well developed and the game just in general is one of the best experiences I've had with a shooter. The guns really are on a whole different level this time around especially with the new element introduced known as slag. I won't go too much into slag but let me just say its a great addition to anyone's arsenal. There's a trading system that is very useful to players and if you want to fight for your guns just start a trade and enter a duel for a winner takes all situation. The enemies are very diverse and some can even evolve mid combat such as the goliath and varkids, which offers plenty of challenge if you let them power up. The game also rewards returning players of the first borderlands as you can interact with the original vault hunters as well as a return of some familiar guns (hellfire, volcano, bone shredder, etc.). Stop reading this and go buy it! It's a game you will NOT regret playing

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
y 24, 2015
												Let me set my small backstory of this game for you guys. Back in 2012 I had my 14th birthday and I'd asked my friends "what should I buy for us to play together?" This was back when I didn't have a PC and played on a Xbox 360, their answer? Borderlands. I bought this interesting little title for around £8 in a CEX. Let me just say, best £8 I'd ever spent, one of the few games I actually bought ALL the DLC for too (GOTY edition was impossible to find, believe me). So of course, I heard rumours of Borderlands 2 and got pretty hype. I saw the release date "September 12th 2012". Pre-Ordered the ♥♥♥♥ outta it. I got home from school that day more excited than a child recieving a lollipop and popped in the disc and played Borderlands 2 for the first time. I'd played atleast 200 hours, perhaps more on it, but never the DLC. So lets say I got 200 hours out of just the MAIN GAME.Later on in life I got a good PC, first thing on my buy list was Borderlands 2. This time, with all the DLC I could get. After completing this game for a 10th time in my life I feel like I should review it. So this is the meat of the review, the game itself. Whilst not going into spoilers I'll give a quick synopsis. You're a Vault Hunter, Handsome Jack wants this Vault, you want to stop him. A generic plot I suppose but very very well written. I've played through this so many times (I say completed 10, but I've had multiple characters I've just started and never finished with) and the dialouge still makes me giggle at times. I find it all just so silly and wacky that it gets to me every time. The main story itself is quite long, you'll need to do side quests to keep leveled alongside the main story, but don't worry, each sidequest is entertaining in itself, varying from robbing a bank, shooting a guy in the face (but not the arm, or body, or leg) to simply jumping off a cliff. The main story is also pretty great, you get emotionally invested in characters, you learn to hate the snark of Handsome Jack, you learn to love the Vault Hunters of the past game, you learn to despise Claptrap and his annoying voice lines.  jk claptrap i love you really The gameplay? Oh my it is so addicting. Looting new guns, out of what the game boasts to be a gazillion, each one with a different possible outcome. Maybe this one will have a scope, or a knife, or BOTH. Grenade Mods offer an interesting use too, altering what your grenades do. My favourite is a singularity grenade, pulls the enemies in and then blows up with them all together. The gunplay itself, while sometimes you feel like you're pretty much throwing a wet paper towel at a wall in the hopes of breaking it down, is also satisfying. Snipers are nice to aim, shotguns have a nice little kick and assault rifles kick ♥♥♥ (I recommend Jakobs). The best part? This game is Co-Op. 1-4 players and A LOT better when experienced in a group than solo, in my opinion. Each person taking a different character from the cast of 6 to vary up gameplay and make a very gorey battlefield.Level design is also great, my favourite map being Lynchwood. Every place has some form of parkour and a lovely look to it, from sweeping vistas in the Highlands, to the metropolis of Opportunity, to the... well... dust of "The Dust". Every place jumps out with life and is memorable in its own way. The game also looks A-MAZ-ING. Cel-Shaded art style is perhaps my favourite when it comes to games and this game just looks so nice with it. A cartoony feel to an over the top game, whilst still managing to maintain beauty of landscapes. The only thing I recommend is not using PhysX, it's known to tank FPS (my friend gets around 40 with it on high and he uses a GTX Titan, just set it to low). The characters you can play as are all pretty damn cool too, I'll just list them:MayaMy current character I'm playing with, was never a fan of the Siren til I played Maya, an absoloute pleasure to play as you control the battlefield, you take key targets out, you revive team mates with Res, you heal, you corrode, you do everything within your power to destroy and reign supreme over the hordes of bandits that Pandora has to throw at you. Also you can shoot your friends to heal them. She has two play styles, a "medic" of sorts, supporting the team, or a absoloute destructive force, murdering hordes of bandits with a quick tap of the ability key.GaigeMy favourite character to play as, she has a giant death robot. That in itself is amazing to me. She has 3 very different trees, the left tree, "Best Friends Forever" focuses on helping newer players out by giving abilities that help things like aim, with an ability that lets bullets riochet off of surfaces and find their way cozily inside that nearby enemies cranium. "Little Big Trouble" focuses on using elemental weapons, mainly shock, to your advantage. The final tree, "Anarchy" is an interesting one, it lets Gaige do more damage at the cost of accuracy, allowing for even the worst gun to become a power house. The best part about this tree is combining this tree with the bullet reflects from the BFF tree, Zer0An interesting fellow, not much is known about this illusive figure, other than he's a badass mofo. He's an assassin, who's specialties are in melee and backstabs, or if you decide to go for it, sniping and pistols. Zer0 has the potential to be one of the best pick of Vault Hunters in the game, able to do ridiculous damage to single targets in a single shot. His ability, Decepti0n, lets Zer0 go into stealth mode and send a decoy that enemies will attack. This is also pretty good for reviving people, but its main use is to pick off a high priority target before a fight starts, or to escape from a fight you can't win. I haven't played as much Zer0 as I have Gaige, but from what I have played I love the guy, and is always a pleasure to have one guy playing the haiku speaking assassin with ya. Also when he revives you he gets a "<3" on his face, what could be better?AxtonAxton was my original guy, after playing Roland in BL1 I felt like going for something similar, Axton was just that. His ability, a turret, can murder enemies pretty efficently. You can chose to level up your turrets or your own ability, the turrets were perhaps my favourite to level up though. You can get a variety of upgrades, a shield on your turret? Rockets? Two turrets? Sure thing, Axton got it all. My main fault with him however is that he's a pretty cover based character, prefering to let his turret to do the dirty work, but a nice character nevertheless.SalvadorSalvador is my least favourite character to play, which is pretty funny considering I like playing them all. His ability, whilst somewhat tame compared to the rest, can be a whole load of fun. Salvador can go "Gunzerk", wielding two weapons at once. Any two, you aren't limited? Two snipers? Go ahead. Two rockets? Sure thing. I can't remember much of my time as gunzerker, I just remember that he was a little guy with a pretty big appetite for destroying everything.  KriegOkay I'll be completly honest with you, I've not got the DLC for Krieg but I can tell you one thing. He solos raid bosses for a living. If you choose him, have fun with that.Closing Note for this reivew. It helps to play Borderlands 1 before this, it will give you a closer bond to some of the characters. But other than that, the main game is absoloutely amazing. I would recommend this game to anyone with an addiction to picking up things with stats and comparing it with other things with stats. Also to any shooter fan. And to anyone. Even your dog. Also before I close this off for good, two things. One, I ran out of space to do DLC reviews and two this may be slightly bias due to my franchise nerdboner, but it is still an amazing game despite that.10/10, would shoot in the face again.

content:
er 26, 2013
												Borderlands 2 is a hectic and thoroughly enjoyable First person RPG shooter.  While replaying the main storyline campaign can get repetitive after a few times, the amount and variety of DLC content keeps the game feeling fresh.  The game comes stock with 4 distinct classes and has two additional ones available through paid DLC.  Each class plays differently and with the talent tree choices even playing the same class over can feel slightly different.  The length of the main story campaign feels decently long but can be rushed through relatively quickly.  That's why I highly suggest playing through all of the available side quests and EXPLORE.  That is one of the bigger selling points of this game for me.  While the story itself can feel linear and pushing you from zone to zone.  The amount of extra quests and areas to discover is great.  I highly recommend this game to fans of the borderlands franchise and newcomers alike.

content:
, 2013
												На планету Пандору прибыли 4 наёмника, чтобы отыскать некое "Хранилище» - кладенец инопланетного оружия и эридианских технологий. Им противостоит корпорация "Hyperion" в лице Красавчика Джека, ставшего президентом этой корпорации и имеющий свои виды на Пандору. Вследствие чего, Джек присылает станцию доставки грузов корпорации в виде буквы "Н", на орбиту Пандоры, и начинает захват планеты. Данная игра представляет собой "Diablo от 1 лица, исполненная в лице шутера": прокачка персонажа, бесконечный опыт за убийство огромных толп врагов, большое количество квестов, к такому количеству приблизился разве что Skyrim. Процесс игры представляет собой формулу: убить и обобрать, а также споры по поводу снаряжения в кооперативе, ибо в игре случайно генерируется ВСЁ, включая награды за квесты. Графика в игре не однозначная, но красивая, присутствует технология nVidia PhysX, что делает бои, более красочными. Из минусов можно отметить унылый однообразный геймплей, присущий играм данного жанра. Оценка: Отлично 8/10

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
er 3, 2016
♥♥♥♥♥ out for Anthony Burch lmao+ Much more self-explanative story than Borderlands 1+ Callbacks and references to Borderlands 1 that aren't too tiring or fan-servicey+ EXTREMELY fleshed out skill trees+ Customization! + Wonderful Vault Hunters to followup the classic 4+ Amazing PC release, as opposed to Borderlands 1+ Great DLC+/- Manages to keep consistent with Borderlands 1's lore, but also flops at times+/- Loot system has improved areas, but is vastly inferior to Borderlands 1's. I will explain this later- Anthony Burch is a gooch with arms, legs and distinct facial features- Late game ( UVHM, OP )- Salvador is a bug altogether.Ferreal, that Borderlands 2 reveal trailer? The Nero one? Rock hard. Never been so excited for a game in my life, and whaddya know-- I had my reasons to be, and they were justified! BL2 was a wonderful follow up and perfected the loot n' shoot formula while constantly feeding me new mechanics and concepts. The way the characters mingle and talk to each other makes everything feel very alive. Pandora is as savage as ever, but still has that goofy sense of humor... Albeit, more in your face. The writing has very strong, and very weak points. The humor is still low brow, absolutely. But there's a lot less kick and punch in it. Like Gearbox is just sort of poking you with a stick constantly until there's a reaction. As of now, this game has six playable characters. Axton, Maya, Salvador, Zer0, Gaige and Krieg ( Axton isn't useless, you goons! You just didn't spec him correctly! ). Some perform well solo, some in groups. Some perform well mobbing, some melt raid bosses. One of them does all of that. Regardless, there is a nice bit of build variation in this game. Much more than Borderlands 1. Most characters were sort of stuck to whatever weapons their tree was designed for. The only thing you'll never need in your life is an Assault Rifle. ♥♥♥♥ sucks eggs.The story is nice, until you read into it-- The very exact opposite of Borderlands 1. Anthony Burch's writing is juvenile, and only shined when writing the silly yet enjoyable series HAWP ( Hey Ash What'cha Playin' ). The biggest merit it has is that Handsome Jack is a saving grace of a villain. I hate him, but damn do I love him. But ♥♥♥♥, do I hate him. The characters in general are pretty fun. Their lines are decent, yet it's more enjoyable to hear them talk about the world of Pandora and their relations with others than dumb jokes, if you ask me. " C-Creech! You're saying so much good about this game! Get to the negatives already! ". Oh. Alright, you little ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. I'll get to the negatives. I HAVE NEVER BEEN SO BORED PLAYING A LATE GAME IN MY LIFE. UVHM has mild issues, such as constant slag reliance, enemy health regen and... That's like, it. The scaling is good. The game keeps up an intermediate difficulty. But the real ♥♥♥♥ starts when OP levels happen. Digistruct Peak is the videogame equivalent of LVL 80 Ultimate Badass Herpes. None of it is original. It's a mix and rehash of other levels with reused enemies and bosses that you go through so... What? You can level up without actually leveling up? No skill point, or increase in health? Sure, difficulty and ' overpowered gear '. But everything in this game two or three shots you unless you're running Evolution, Sham or Salvador in general. There is zero sense of accomplishment in this. It's a bitter relief that ends short because you still have to do it upwards of eight. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Times. The reliance of Red Text ( Legendaries / Unique Blues ) is boring, cookie cutter and toxic to the genuine fun factor this game brings. I've heard the argument that it's ' the thrill of the chase '. What chase? Resetting your game fifty times for an item that most people just cheat engined anyways? I was a firm believer that getting all my items legit would feel good and not as cheap as a save file. God was I wrong. After 20+ hours of farming Doc Mercy for a fire Dva Infinity with at least a Vladof or Jakobs grip on it, I was ready to just call it quits. Once you reach a certain point, non-red text weapons are useless. The point of the Borderlands series was the glow and smile you got when opening a chest. Late game, chests are useless. There's so many legendaries that the chance of getting something good or useful is nil. AND DON'T EVEN GET ME STARTED ON PEARLESCENTS. Legit. Don't get me started. This review's gone on long enough. Not feeling it.As a Borderlands veteran, the endgame to this was so mind numbing and irritating that I just went back to Borderlands 1. Sure, less content. But, a more enjoyable, fulfilling experience. If you're new to Borderlands, consider picking up GOTY when it's on sale sometime. You won't regret it! This game is good, but has glaring flaws that has left me sort of iffy on playing it anymore after just 300 hours. That's a lot of time, mind you. And if you see no issues in the ones I pointed out, you could have double that.

number of helpful: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful
content:
er 20, 2014
												Начну издалека, но буду краток. Вы ведь знаете игру под названием Left 4 Dead? В свое время она наделала шороха и раздвинула рамки кооперативных шутеров. Лучше ее… только Left 4 Dead 2, объединившая в себе все лучшее, что было в первой части, умножив ее на еще одну группу из четверых героев, новое оружие, новые кампании, и переработанную динамику боя соединенную с более высокой интерактивностью окружающего мира. Такая же формулировка верна и в отношении Borderlands 2. Новые герои – старые мотивы. И это тот самый случай, когда новый друг совсем не хуже старых двух. Друзей становится больше. На четыре единицы. Четыре персонажа, проработанные так же тщательно, как и предыдущие герои. В случае если вы пожелаете приобрести DLC количество «охотников за ковчегом» увеличится до шести. Нет смысла расписывать все улучшения, которые появились в Borderlands 2 – пусть это будет сюрпризом для поклонников серии. Стоит отметить лишь, что бой стал еще более динамичным. Что ощущение оружия в руках не исчезло. Напротив. Положа руку на сердце, могу сказать, что такого количества оружия в играх я еще не видел. И речь не о том, как оно выглядит. Эффективного оружия. Интересного оружия. Оружия, которое хочется держать в руках, и из которого хочется палить. Даже в воздух. Даже просто в стену, лед или камень. Чтобы слышать как оно поет.Речь о функциональности этого оружия. О его манере боя. Об уникальности присущей каждой его единице. Кучность, отдача, время перезарядки, дальность, спец-возможности, дизайн - все это не просто данные. К оружию идет привыкание, как это когда-то происходило в игре Jagged Alliance. Только вот к оружию привыкаете вы, а не NPC. И потом ищете что-либо похожее именно на эту модель, именно с такими же характеристиками. Скажу более, частенько вы согласны воевать устаревшей моделью, которая наносит противнику меньше урона, затягивает продолжительность боя. Просто потому, что с этим стволом – вам комфортно. Колоритные персонажи, замечательные боссы, великолепные панорамы Пандоры. Пост-апокалиптика во всей своей красе. Тонны оружия, десятки и сотни тысяч выпущенных пуль, десятки и сотни мест, каждое из которых имеет свой дизайн и историю. Апгрейды, улучшения и мини-перки. Ну и куда без визитной карточки этой игры. Потешного робота, шутника, клоуна и феерического размаха трепла, о котором сэр Хаммерлок схватившись за голову как-то сказал «О боже… он опять говорит». Все это здесь. Всего стало больше. Всего стало дольше. Да и старые герои, как и в упомянутой L4D2, никуда не исчезли. Они рядом. И вы еще не раз их увидите. Хороший напиток не выдыхается. Он настаивается. Тоже произошло и с этой игрой. Боевая механика выросла настолько, что первая часть игры, после динамики боя второй части, ощущается несколько пресноватой. Наверное, неспроста Gearbox Software решили выпустить переиздание первой части, снабдив её всем тем чего они добились во второй. Не знаю как для вас, а для меня это - отличная новость. Я люблю Пандору. Люблю этот мир, и также люблю торчать в магазине, или в игровых автоматах этого мира, подбирая себе револьвер по вкусу.Как и в случае первой части, если вы все же начали зевать – попробуйте кооператив. Игры подобного плана в кооперативе начинают играть всеми цветами радуги. Одни забеги за «лучшим чемоданом» чего стоят. Не говоря уже о возрастающей сложности игры, и куда более богатом луте.P.S.Было бы очень некрасиво с моей стороны не отметить особо саундтрек к игре с участием Джаспера Кида. Кому-то это имя может быть незнакомо, но вряд ли кто-то незнаком с такими игровыми сериалами как Hitman и Assassin's Creed. Ну и, конечно же, с героями данного обзора Borderlands и Borderlands 2. Если за сто или двести часов вы ни разу не выключали музыку, должно быть это чего-то да стоит.
