content:
11, 2013
												If you enjoyed the first Borderlands then this will fill like the mega deluxe sequel to it. Gearbox doesn't change up the formula much. It's just more of the good stuff. More highly detailed levels. More classes to play. More guns and interesting gun stats (like throwing your guns like grenades when you reload!). More Story. Way more jokes from the crude, to the ludicrous, dark, and ironic.I have three criticisms but they are small. First the level designs are very highly detailed with scale. Some areas have seven floors and often times you can see multiple floors at the same time. It can be hard to process every thing that is happening at once. Second the NPCs talk over each other. If you want to hear what they say just stop moving. If you trigger another conversation it will just completely cut off the other one with no hope of retrieving it. Some of the areas are really long and you can easily be killing guys for up to an hour before another plot exposition. Maybe I'm just ADD but you can easily forget what was going on.Over all Borderlands 2 is very very good with over 30 hours of content. I finished this game and felt like I could easily find another 15 hours and that's before all the extra DLC. The co-op in this game is no joke either. The enemies scale accordingly so it's not a cake walk and working together is a must in this shooter.  Easily worth it at full price. Pretty much a must buy at $15.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
2, 2014
												After more than 200 hours of gameplay (which were totally worth it) on all three game mods through numerous side missions and DLCs, I have few things to say about this game. Like, it's awesome!It was a great idea to combine a FPS with an RPG in case of Borderlands, it's even more so with Borderlands 2. Compared to its predecessor, Borderlands 2 has a lot of improvements: better graphics, better characters, more convenient interface, easier loot picking (money and ammo is picked automatically, by walking over them), more DLCs, more humor, more various enemies, more maps, more action, better skill trees.I think what makes Borderlands 2 such a great game and a must-have, is its unique setting of Pandora with its outlaws, monsters and dark politically incorrect humour.However, there are some things that are annoying and/or disappointing.1. Loot system: 98% of weapons and equipment are crap. All great or just decent weapons are rare. The unique reward weapons often are worse than the regular weapons that you have already equiped. Also, in Borderlands 2 there are only 5 million weapon combinations, whereas in Borderlands there are 17 million combinations. With that said, a lot of time is spent on comparing and sorting weapons, which at some point becomes frustrating. I wish there were some kind of automatic recommendations that could help save time. Well, there is a colour system – orange weapons and purple weapons should theroretically be the best, but that's not always the case. I think a filter system would be handy, when a player can set preferences for potential loot.2. Side missions: some of the side missions are really stupid, like ''go there and pick X number of things'' or ''walk a skag (sort of a dog-like monster) for 5 mins not killing it''. Such missions are typical in RPG games, but in my opinion this should have been one RPG aspect Gearbox should have skipped. Also, a major part of side missions has a very weak storyline or no storyline at all.3. Maps: some might disagree, but I personally hate these serpentine-like maps with endless turns and hidden passages. Also, it's hard to locate a target in a monochromatic, schematic representation of a multi-level area in a mini-map. You have to guess on which level the target actually is, e.g., in a cave or on a cliff, on the ground floor or rooftop. I'd prefer if the distance would be indicated as in Assassin's Creed.4. Fast travel stations: you travel distance and between maps either by vehicles or using fast travel stations. As a result, lots of time is spent by either running or driving and fighting the enemies you had already killed before. I'd rather prefer an outpost system as in FarCry 3.5. Vehicles: often it's much easier to be a pedestrian. Besides, the vehicle guns are weak and impractical.6. Unbalanced leveling and enemies. Apart from Ultimate Vault Hunter mode, in which you face enemies who are two levels higher than you and quite hard to kill, in Normal Mode and True Vault Hunter mode, you mostly face weak enemies and around level 30 further leveling becomes annoyingly slow, since the experience gained is ridiculously small but the necesssary amount of experience points gets higher and higher with each level. Also, I don't think that there should be a level cap (which is 72 with the second upgrade pack), because some of the bosses in the Ultimate Vault Hunter Mode are of level 80 - that means that you can't possibly kill them.7. This game is pushing Co-Op, because some of the missions are so hard, it's almost impossible to beat the game in single-player - you just get tired of dying and wasting expensive ammo on hordes of enemies.8. Finally, I don't think that it's fair that all the DLCs are not included in the Season Pass or GOTY edition. With the exhausting level-ups and search for legendary weapons, it's just plain exploitation of players. It's a sort of corporate behaviour you would expect from EA and Ubisoft.Although there are points when Borderlands feels just like a pointless loot grab and desperate skill tree development, it is one of my top favourite games. I hope the Borderlands Presequel would be even better.9/10.P.S. I recommend to read this more detailed review by Michale Barnes: http://www.nohighscores.com/2012/09/26/why-i-think-borderlands-2-sucks-but-i-like-it/. It gives an honest representation of what the gameplay actually is like.

content:
8, 2013
												В игре открытый мир, состоящий из трех десятков отделенных друг от друга локаций. Каждый кусочек Пандоры обставлен по-своему: помимо ландшафтного эксклюзива на диких территориях встречаются градообразующие предприятия, пещеры монстров, лагеря бандитов, небольшие деревушки, пустыни, трубопроводы, индустриальный завод, лаборатория с удивительными растениями и животными, высоченные ледники. Дизайн каждого объекта, каждого населенного пункта – изумителен; уникальный, рисованный графический стиль; тщательная проработка каждой детали. В игре многообразие оружия. Игра автоматически генерирует характеристики находимых или «выпадающих» из монстров экземпляров, создавая огромнейший арсенал: начиная от обычных пистолетов и заканчивая снайперками с разрывными патронами и кислотными гранатометами. В игре много юмора и побочных и сюжетных миссий. Музыкальное сопровождение восхитительно: мелодия чутко реагирует на появление больших скоплений агрессивных врагов и очень хорошо сочетается с общим стилем локаций. Есть сетевая игра на четверых игроков. Моя оценка 10/10.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
er 25, 2015
												Following on from the first Borderlands game, Borderlands 2 improves upon the formula in a number of ways. In addition to the story being far more grandiose this time around, there are some key improvements to the general gameplay:  Infinitely more dialogue between characters this time around, adds life to the world.  Far more map variety. Original game was based almost exclusively in dusty outdoor maps. This time around, you visit lush Oasis environments, eridium riddled locales, etc etc.  Character differentiation. Mister Torgue and Tiny Tina are utterly hilarious and brilliant.  Gun engineering. The guns this time around really feel different between manufacturers. In the original game, the only real difference between weapons was whether it was elemental or not.If you enjoyed the first game, then you will have a blast with this.Highly recommended.Played on Windows 10 Pro x64 without any problems.

content:
8, 2013
												В игре открытый мир, состоящий из трех десятков отделенных друг от друга локаций. Каждый кусочек Пандоры обставлен по-своему: помимо ландшафтного эксклюзива на диких территориях встречаются градообразующие предприятия, пещеры монстров, лагеря бандитов, небольшие деревушки, пустыни, трубопроводы, индустриальный завод, лаборатория с удивительными растениями и животными, высоченные ледники. Дизайн каждого объекта, каждого населенного пункта – изумителен; уникальный, рисованный графический стиль; тщательная проработка каждой детали. В игре многообразие оружия. Игра автоматически генерирует характеристики находимых или «выпадающих» из монстров экземпляров, создавая огромнейший арсенал: начиная от обычных пистолетов и заканчивая снайперками с разрывными патронами и кислотными гранатометами. В игре много юмора и побочных и сюжетных миссий. Музыкальное сопровождение восхитительно: мелодия чутко реагирует на появление больших скоплений агрессивных врагов и очень хорошо сочетается с общим стилем локаций. Есть сетевая игра на четверых игроков. Моя оценка 10/10.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
er 25, 2015
												Following on from the first Borderlands game, Borderlands 2 improves upon the formula in a number of ways. In addition to the story being far more grandiose this time around, there are some key improvements to the general gameplay:  Infinitely more dialogue between characters this time around, adds life to the world.  Far more map variety. Original game was based almost exclusively in dusty outdoor maps. This time around, you visit lush Oasis environments, eridium riddled locales, etc etc.  Character differentiation. Mister Torgue and Tiny Tina are utterly hilarious and brilliant.  Gun engineering. The guns this time around really feel different between manufacturers. In the original game, the only real difference between weapons was whether it was elemental or not.If you enjoyed the first game, then you will have a blast with this.Highly recommended.Played on Windows 10 Pro x64 without any problems.

content:
11, 2013
												If you enjoyed the first Borderlands then this will fill like the mega deluxe sequel to it. Gearbox doesn't change up the formula much. It's just more of the good stuff. More highly detailed levels. More classes to play. More guns and interesting gun stats (like throwing your guns like grenades when you reload!). More Story. Way more jokes from the crude, to the ludicrous, dark, and ironic.I have three criticisms but they are small. First the level designs are very highly detailed with scale. Some areas have seven floors and often times you can see multiple floors at the same time. It can be hard to process every thing that is happening at once. Second the NPCs talk over each other. If you want to hear what they say just stop moving. If you trigger another conversation it will just completely cut off the other one with no hope of retrieving it. Some of the areas are really long and you can easily be killing guys for up to an hour before another plot exposition. Maybe I'm just ADD but you can easily forget what was going on.Over all Borderlands 2 is very very good with over 30 hours of content. I finished this game and felt like I could easily find another 15 hours and that's before all the extra DLC. The co-op in this game is no joke either. The enemies scale accordingly so it's not a cake walk and working together is a must in this shooter.  Easily worth it at full price. Pretty much a must buy at $15.

content:
ry 21, 2015
												A fun adventure to play, an even funnier one with teammates!The self-definition of the first Borderlands game was "FPS and RPG had a baby", and what a baby! And what little brother!Despite the revamp of hud, weapons trades and skill trees, this second game keeps its cartoon graphics, open-like world and fast paced shootings, and introduces many old and new hilarious characters, as well as a detailed and entertaining story.This game will surely please any FPS player each his own way, thanks to the 6 playable characters and their action skills, its four difficulties, and extra campaigns.An important, extra note about difficulties and level cap. Normal and True Vault Hunter Mode difficulties include a NPC level cap (of 30 and 50 respectively), meaning that enemies will stop leveling as you are past this level, even if you keep earning experience. This is important after completing TVHM, since the Ultimate Vault Hunter Mode brings quite a difficulty gap compared to the previous one, and not everybody will enjoy it. If you are in this case like i am, you shall disable the UVHM update in order to prevent your character from leveling past level 50, and keep enjoying TVHM.

ber 23, 2015
												Hellooo Vault Hunter! Welcome! Welcome to Pandora! To your right you will see a couple of Hyperion robots peacefully grazing in the meadows with some Bullymongs roasting Bandits in the background, to your left you'll see a magical UNICORN PRINCESS. Now you are welcome to stay as long as you want but beware for the Handsome one is up and about! Happy Shooting!You play as a Vault Hunter choosing between the classes and skills of Assassin (Deception), Siren (Phaselock), Gunzerker (Gunzerk), Commando (Summon a turret) and Psycho (Rampage).Borderlands 2 allows players to complete a campaign consisting of central quests and optional side-missions as one of five treasure seekers. Online collaborative campaign gameplay, randomly generated loot, such as weapons and shields will be the weapons that you obtain as you defeat enemies and monsters in the world. The world of Pandora is rich, colorful and beautiful. Once the game begins you will be engulfed in the story which has amazing narrative. BTW this game is basically GUN PRON so get ready to have multiple extatic episodes as you finally get the weapon you crave. The weapons are the heart of this game and each company that makes the guns give them different properties which can make you fall in love with them or simply turn away from them. The customization in guns as well as skins give your character a change.The levels go to 72 and then you can go to OP LEVELS! (Which go to OP 8)This has been one of the funnest shoot-em-ups I've ever played! With the witty dialog, amazing characters and great storyline I was laughing over and over. I would recomend buying the Game of the Year edition to get the DLC but if youre not keen on buying dlc then at least get the Tiny Tinas Attack on Dragon Keep. The best DLC I've played as of now not one DLC has come close to the beauty of this DLC.This game is amazing and funny. 10/10 MUST BUYHAPPY HUNTING VAULT HUNTER!

content:
er 27, 2013
												Addiction to the max...Let me get the easy and mandatory stuff of the way:The Graphics:Okay so this is the same engine as 3 years ago. However, there are improvements, at least on the PC version. The physx is now able to display some cool visual effects. The improvements include+hundreds of sparkles from explosion guns;+ fire looks like fire now;+the corrosion goo now oozes out on the ground and cascades down the slopes;+ the battlegrounds are now littered with pieces of rocks and gravel (that do not disappear by the way);the electric guns now display more sparkling effects;+there is now some sun glare+there is now aurora borealis+there are some nice snow and desert effects+the anti-aliasing has been greatly improved+the day to night shift has also been improvedThe Cons:-the water looks pretty much the same though-we still get Directx9-Visually, everything about the game has been improved except that you still cast no shadow and you still can't see your legs-The Resolution problem. okay so I thought I was playing with my native 1920x1080 resolution until I figured out (at level 10) that you needed to change the resolution one more time IN-GAME. Apparently, changing resolution in the game menu does squat. So I've been playing the crappy console 1080x720 whitewash resolution for about two hours before I figured out what was wrong. DON'T MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE.-SLOW texture loading, just like in the first game. Whenever you enter a new are or go into a shop it will take a couple of seconds for textures to load. Thanks consoles!Okay as for the gameplay:It remains largely unchanged however there are improvements. The sprint effects are now more realistic. One of the things I liked is that it is MUCH MUCH harder to earn money now. I reached level 18 and rarely had more than $ 1500 bucks in my pocket. This is a breath of fresh air considering that you could easily rack up $ 200,000 by the time you hit level 15. ( I am not even mentioning the exploit of cloning artifacts and rejoining friend's game to essentially have infinite money). Also, I should mention that they now got rid of all those unnecessary zeroes, as in, there really is no reason to sell a gun for $ 254,620 when they could downplay the entire currency by a factor of 1000. Ergo, you would have to buy the gun for $ 254 instead.The skill tree is somewhat the same from the first games with some similar perks.They now added Eridium as currency, which is rare. Except you can only use it to upgrade your ammo/grenade/backpack capacity.They haven't changed the driving. It is still a keyboard+mouse driving which still sucks.They also now added caravans which can get attacked and then get looted for rare weapons.The elemental effects largely remain the same. Fire is good against flesh and corrosion is now really effective against armor (robots don't have shield or health anymore, only armor). Also, robots are easily taken out when their limbs are blown off.It seems like the auto-assist weaker than in the first game but it can still be felt.The enemies are even more hilarious now. The voice acting is great (same goes for THE friendly NPCs), especially when you hear the midget armored goliaths talk. It's obvious they try to overcompensate for their vertical challenge by being extra badass. The enemies still do the barrel rolls, they still take cover and can spend up to 5 seconds and they can also jump from platform to platform. There are also the buzzers (make-shift propelled helicopters much like in the mad max movies) which are pretty fun to shoot down. It's even more fun when they sing the Ride of the Valkyries composition (from Apocalypse now), it's pretty amusing. Some midgets ride on each others' heads too.I'm not too sure about the insects though. They are gross and disgusting to fight.In general, it is still way more fun to fight humans or rather, the humanoids, rather than the robots and the beasties.The weapons:I'm not sure if it's me but it looks like they put more effort into adding more flare to almost every other gun. The seemingly random-generated stats are still there but at least gun skins look more flamboyant and peculiar. They also varied the standard appearance types somewhat. So, not every rifle gun is necessarily elongated for instance.The story:It's a continuation of the first story (perhaps a couple of years after opening of the vault) wherein The Handsome Jack, who is in charge of the Hyperion Corporation is attempting to open an even bigger vault and obtain control of the prehistoric monster to rule Pandora. The story has some twists, surprisingly and it's always welcome to see the good old friendly NPC's again.In the end, perhaps this could quality as Borderlands 2 since it's a continuation of story and all, I just didn't really feel like it was a new installment all that much, a lot of things feel same, although it's a definite improvement over the old one. There is more narrative, more quests, new enemies, new artifacts, mods, etc. etc. But there is not necessarily more depth, perhaps it is so because of the type of game itself. However, there are plenty of comical and satirical moments that catch you off-guard. The game is also littered with easter eggs.

												Love it, A game i've been playing since day one with my Lil brother (a game which me and him have at least 5000hrs), across many platform. I just recently got it for the pc to play with a friend, that has never played the second installment. I'd like to say its one of a kind, for what it is, and I am thankful for this game for bringing me and my Lil brother so much joy, and headachs since the first one. The dlc's ( especially Tiny TIna's Assualt On Dragon Keep) are actually fantastic. Other then Captain Scarlett being a late down and Carnage ( which Is okay because of Mister Torgue) where lack luster.. Or to me atleast. The loot system is pretty nice for what it is, I do enjoy getting that suprise when I find an Violet or even legendary item drop. Other then some spawn rate for certain items, It's okay. It's what i like about the game, can't say how much time i spent trying to find the right Weapon in the right stats.. The days and nights that would go by.  However it's a must have for Everyone that has few friend to mess around with and just have fun. Goofy, bloody, aggressive fun.

												One of my favourite games of all time, with over 300 hours of gameplay on the ol' PS3...and still, Borderlands 2 is a hell lot of fun to replay on PC.The combination of RPG elements, like endless amount of loot to collect (over 870 'Gajillion' guns according to the developers), various optimization options, skill trees, 6 playable characters that really differ from each other in playstyle and strengths, with the best of first-person-shooting is just so well done, it is just hard to describe it.When this game is on sale, you can get the GOTY-Edition for just like 10 bucks AND YOU GET SO MUCH IN RETURN.This is one of those games that really get stuck in your brain, the amazing feeling of walking through the desert, supported by fitting guitar riffs, holding your beloved, rare and green-yellow-glowing shotgun in your bloody hands, beheading half-naked psychos charging at you with hilarious phrases like 'Suck my ♥♥♥♥, Mommy!'.You gotta love it.Graphics: 4/5    For a cell-shading game it looks beautiful.Music: 5/5         Every setting comes with a fitting calm and battle theme that gets stuck so easily.Gameplay: 5/5So grab one to three friends and get sucked into this jewel.Wub wub.

content:
23, 2014
												I have played this game for over 1200 hours. As such, I have explored all 6 classes, almost all of the skill sets, tried most of the weapons, etc. How they can make a game fun for as long as I have enjoyed this is beyond me. I played and really liked the first Borderlands, but this one is better yet and I have the pre-sequel already pre-ordered. While it is not a true sandbox as we have come to know, it gives enough general freedom to explore. It awards those who like to be thorough with up to 69 achievements and a lot of challenges which gives you B@d@$$ points you can spend within the game to make all your characters stronger. My negatives are relatively minor. The game limits players from leveling above 72, but then introduces over-powered enemies through Raid On Digistruct Peak that then goes up to overpowered 8 (OP8). I understand the logic to this as they don't want everyone to have every skillset. However, there is no way that I know of to look at a level 72 player to know if they are playing as 72 or OP8. There is a big difference in the strength of the items and if an OP8 person joins your standard level 72 game they one-shot-kill everything. Overall, great game. I love the cooperative aspect. Without it, I wouldn't probably have ever played online. I hope as hardware gets stronger, they can make the graphics better and/or add more players to the mix. I don't think it probably is possible, but being able to game with someone on a console, PC, and MAC would be awesome. Thanks for all the enjoyment Gearbox!

content:
, 2016
												Borderlands 2, great first person shooter in an open world journey. I hardly played the first installment, but with hardly any knowledge of the story, Borderlands 2 does a great job getting you caught up. You also interact with the first game's characters. You start off with four completely different characters to choose from, each exhibiting their own specialties. I went with Axton for the overall easy feel of a balanced character.You're put into a world full of chaos and violence, annoyed by an obvious attention seeking toaster who craves your friendship and help. With any typical MMO you must supply yourself with loot found, bought or traded from fellow players. The game's main antagonist, wonderfully named Handsome Jack, keeps in contact with you throughout your entire journey, spewing threats and relatively creative insults. The game does offer multitude of side quests to keep you entertained, and easter eggs that are uniquely fun to find.Pros:- The story. It is action packed and immensely pleasing- The characters. Each character brings their own satisfying opinions.- Free roaming. Progress when you want to.- Repeatable bosses. Some days I enjoy fighting an old boss without having to start over.- Looooot. It is everywhere.- Character customization. - Plenty of fun DLC worth the money.- Easily a 200+ hour game.- Co-op is fun and rewarding.Cons:- Claptrap. Many like him, I can't stand him.- Most side quests are just pickup or kill certain amounts.- Builds can become too cookie cutter to obtain max efficiency of your character.- Some special abilities more overpowered than others. (more nit picking here)The game is worth its current price, but the game of the year edition should be considered for purchase. You will get two new characters and most or all the current DLCs. There is still an active online community willing to play and help, at least the players I've come across have been really fun and easy to get along with.

												Great. Caught my attention since the first released images and videos and i still play it since release day.  It caught my attention so badly, made me play with all the classes until the end. The cel shading effect, which is one of the identities of the game alongside the characteristic humor, blends in with the world amazingly. Think of Diablo's looting system, now add FPS and humor to it, you have Borderlands 2. I highly enjoyed the first game, and LOVED the second one. Also, on a side note, this is an Easter-egg filled with a game in it. I warn you beforehand, SO MANY REFERENCES.10/10.

content:
er 26, 2013
												First time I've heard of Borderlands 2 I was like "Meh, another blurry movie, Borderlands 1 FTW". But then I've got a "pirated" edition of the game. It was SO AWESOME and without any doubts I did remove it and got BL2 + Season Pass + Preorder DLC + Mechromancer pack.What's so awesome about it? Let me explain.First: "traditional Borderlands" humor. Violence, black humor etc. It's not annoying or way too brutal. Just fit the game setting.Second: awesome characters, story line, dialogues. Even though Handsome Jack is a villain of the game - he's awesome as well. I were waiting for all the ECHO transmissions, never skept any cutscenes and did all the side quests. A lot of entertainment here.Third: of course, it's graphics. You can say "booo, battlefield 4 has better graph" - you're kinda right, yeah. But nobody cares about "realistic" graphics here. It's like you're playing comics.Fourth: nice characters. I can't say they have an awesome storyline (but i did like Maya's story at least) but gameplay aspect is just headsmashing. A lot of variants how to play each character, way better than Borderlands 1.Fifth: DLCs. Yeah, eve though you can say "RIPOFF!!! TOO MUCH DLCS!!! THEY'RE NOT WORTH ANY CENT!!!". Actually they ARE worthy. Not kidding. 4 DLC's included in a Season Pass providing SO MUCH CONTENT. And all the content is not like "Meh, they'll buy it anyway". No. They're detailed. They're providing experience that can be compared to the base game(and imo Tiny Tina's DLC is even GREATER than the base game).Sixth and the last: co-op play. "Adventure time. c'mon grab your friends, this time we'll play the Borderlands". Nothing to say. It's SO GREAT for co-oping. It's awesome when you can count on friends standing behind you, ready to help, revive or even heal you.In total I'll say this game is definetily worth EVERY cent you pay for it. If you like GOOD action games - you should get it. My overall score is TEN out of TEN.
